name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Limited Release
review: The tannins are green and edgy, supporting a pleasant core of dusty currant, gravel and graphite flavors. Ends with a kiss of vanilla-laced oak. Gains complexity, but grippy tannins stand in the way. Drink now through 2025. 198 cases made.

name: Grenache Templeton Gap District
review: Smoky bacon and dried cherry aromas open to snappy raspberry, spicy cinnamon and grilled herb flavors. Drink now through 2025. 158 cases made.

name: Zephyr Paso Robles
review: Ripe and exotic, with boysenberry and smoke aromas and black currant, peppered beef and earthy licorice flavors that finish with big, zesty tannins. Zinfandel, Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2015. 450 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles
review: Intense and ripe, this is loaded with aromas of blackberry, blueberry and licorice, with concentrated flavors of black currant, mocha and espresso bean.The tannins are firm and a bit dried out. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: ZcRED Paso Robles
review: Easy-drinking, with wild blueberry, huckleberry and blackberry flavors ripe and spicy, generous toast and jammy notes on a firm frame with chewy tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2014. 909 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles
review: Muted and disjointed, with modest smoky cherry and sage notes. 754 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Wonderful aromas of black licorice and blueberry lead to a full body, with juicy, round tannins. Luscious and decadent. Might be better on toast! A gorgeous wine, this is the real deal for Amarone. Why wait? But a little bottle age should really bring it together. Best after 2011. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Dried thyme and rosemary are a fragrant entry point for this sleek red, cloaking muscular tannins in a well-spiced robe of currant pâte de fruit, tarry mineral and fruitcake flavors, with rich hints of melted licorice and mocha and a firm, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2029. 1,500 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Mouthwatering, with lush notes of black cherry coulis, raspberry ganache, strawberry preserves, ground anise and espresso. Fine-grained tannins frame this vibrant, silky red, with smoke, dried herb and spice notes echoing on the lasting finish. Drink now through 2028. 1,250 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: A pure note of lingonberry preserves heralds this finely knit, mouthwatering red. The ripe fruit is meshed with supple tannins and flavors of dried marjoram, dark chocolate shavings, rich, woodsy minerality and creamy melted licorice. Offers a lasting, harmonious finish. Drink now through 2030. 4,666 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Light tannins add subtle grip to this supple Amarone, framing flavors of sticky, sun-dried date, black cherry,  and crushed black raspberry, with aromatic hints of sweet smoke, loose tea leaf and lots of ground spice. The finish is long and refined. Drink now through 2030. 1,250 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: This is rich and full-bodied yet elegant overall, showing supple tannins layered with a sleek, finely knit mix of baked black currant, fig cake, dried thyme and coffee liqueur flavors. A streak of fragrant, smoky mineral drives the finish. Drink now through 2026. 1,500 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Tarry smoke and grilled herb notes herald this dense, full-bodied red, along with details of ground coffee, blackberry pâte de fruit, dark chocolate shavings and ground pink peppercorn. Long and supple, with a lasting, rich and creamy finish. Drink now through 2026. 1,500 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Flavors of plum sauce, dark chocolate, date and herb-marinated black olive are rich and ripe up front, with fine integration of the muscular tannins, bright acidity and smoky minerality. This shows a finesse belied by the exuberant nose, with a lasting, fruit-filled finish. Drink now through 2030. 1,500 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: This thick, creamy version delivers layered flavors of black cherry and blackberry pâte de fruit, treacle, date, aromatic ground spice, and accents of graphite and tea leaf. Supple tannins show on the lightly chewy, juicy finish. Drink now through 2026. 1,400 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Hints of earth and smoke accent the damson plum, dried cherry and chocolate flavors in this ripe and fresh red. There's good richness here, and a long, full-throttle finish.--Non-blind Amarone retrospective (2010). Drink now through 2025. 320 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: A modern style, packed with prune, chocolate, vanilla and spice character, and with a slight cheesy note that I associate with great, ageable wines, this is young and monolithic. Boasts ripe, mouthcoating tannins and vibrant acidity. All the components are here, just be patient. Best from 2000 through 2015. 830 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Subdued notes of dried black cherry, prune, dark chocolate and grilled herb are underscored by smoky sous-bois details in this tightly knit, balanced red. The sinewy tannins lend some muscle. Should benefit from short-term cellaring. Best from 2017 through 2027. 1,250 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Big, chewy. Outstanding. It bubbles over with floral, ripe berry and fruit character. Full-bodied and very chunky, with lots of big, chewy tannins. Massive finish. Give it time. Best after 2003. 4,165 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Elegant, yet with good intensity, showing a bright tanginess to the acidity that enlivens flavors of dried cranberry, date, kirschwasser and aromatic dried herbs and spices. Layered and lightly chewy, with just a touch of heat on the long finish of sweet fruit. Drink now through 2020. 1,400 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Minerally and intense on the nose, with clean aromas of currant, dried spice and mineral. Full, tightly packed palate, with big velvety tannins and a long finish. Best after 2008. 1,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Spicy, raisiny fruit, with nuts and minerals. Full-bodied, with a hint of bitter chocolate coming through on the palate and firm tannins driving through the long finish. Classy Amarone, with all the essential ingredients. Good stuff, but still a baby. Best after 2005. 1,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Big and rich. Loads of dried fruit, raisins and Indian spices on the nose. Full-bodied and chewy, with round tannins and a long, spicy chocolate aftertaste. A beauty. Drink now through 2005. 1,668 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Superiore Ripassa
review: There's a symphony of flavor in this medium-bodied red, which offers ripe boysenberry and damson plum fruit overlaid by lovely rose and violet floral notes, with details of loamy espresso, anise and fresh herbs. A finely cut wine, with a velvety mouthfeel coating lightly chewy tannins and vivacious acidity. Drink now through 2022. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 13,700 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: There's lovely balance to this creamy Amarone, with delicate spice and orange zest accents enlivening the flavors of black cherry puree, dried lavender, date and mineral. Well-knit tannins provide a supple frame. A crowd-pleaser.  Drink now through 2026. 2,600 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Ripe, with sun-dried cherry, date and treacle notes, this is balanced and juicy, presenting a velvety palate and hints of melted licorice, grilled herb, cocoa powder and sweet smoke, lingering on the supple finish. Drink now through 2025. 1,050 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: A core of ground spice and herb notes mixes with flavors of brambly blackberry and cassis, loamy earth and hints of treacle and cocoa powder. Features well-meshed tannins and an elegant finish. Drink now through 2023. 1,250 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Distinctive mineral character surrounds the fresh red and black fruit, with hints of fresh herbs, licorice and clay. Full-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, well-balanced finish. Elegant and refined, with lots of character. Best after 2007. 6,700 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Very nutty and floral on the nose, with crushed black fruit and notes of violet and fresh herbs. Full-bodied and fresh, with lots of dried fruit and floral character, fine, firm tannins and a long, mineral finish. Tightly packed and refined. Best after 2009. 1,000 cases made.

name: Corvina Verona Cresasso
review: Dark and brooding flavors of blackberry and black currant fruit mix with hints of dusty cocoa powder and mineral, with an array of aromatic ground spices. Firm tannins wrap this tightly right now, but it shows the balance of a wine that should open up nicely. Best from 2014 through 2024. 1,850 cases made.

name: Corvina Veronese Cresasso
review: A harmonious red, showing flavors of black cherry coulis, licorice string, tangy dried cranberry and grilled herb. Fine and creamy, with supple tannins and a hint of minerality framing the finish. Drink now through 2025. 1,850 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Pretty aromas of boysenberry and sliced plum lead to a full body, with unctuous ripe fruit. Round and ready. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Enticing aromas of slightly raisiny fruit, with spices and wet stone. Full-bodied, with a fresh, fruity palate, a good mineral backbone and a long finish. Best after 2004. 5,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Already displaying some of the exotic, spicy, nutty characteristics typical of maturing Amarone, yet there's freshness, great balance and depth. Very complex and inviting. Drinkable now, but hold if you like more mature flavors. 45,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Sergio Zenato Riserva
review: Offers dried berries, with hints of treacle tart and slate. Full-bodied, with firm tannins and racy acidity. Dense, yet slightly reserved. Still needs time to open. Best after 2010. 300 cases imported.

name: Corvina Veronese Cresasso
review: This fresh red is medium-bodied, offering focused flavors of black cherry and boysenberry coulis, dried thyme and cocoa powder without being weighty. The tannins are supple, and this ends with a creamy, spiced finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,850 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Barriques
review: This sculpted red offers aromatic notes of dried marjoram and ground pink peppercorn up front, with black currant pâte de fruit, plum cake, mocha and steeped cherry flavors, underscored by a savory streak of forest floor. Tightly knit and focused. Best from 2017 through 2029. 800 cases made.

name: Vigneti delle Dolomiti Sortì
review: A rich, dry white, with a core of spice accenting layered flavors of baked apple, crystallized honey, pastry, marzipan, smoky stone and tangy tangerine. This shows subtle integration and an overall sense of elegance. Pinot Bianco and Riesling. Drink now through 2018. 700 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Vigne Alte
review: Displays pure aromas and flavors of currant and raisin, with notes of citrus peel and vibrant spices that keep everything fresh. Full- to medium-bodied, with a round, fruity palate, well-integrated tannins and a clean, spicy fruit finish. A new winery to watch. Drink now through 2012. 4,500 cases made.

name: Brut Trento Maso Nero Riserva
review: Dry, with a smoky base note and flavors of pie shell, dried pineapple and pickled ginger. Shows good intensity, lightly creamy texture and a nut-tinged finish. Drink now through 2017. 300 cases made.

name: Teroldego Rotaliano Lealbere
review: A sleek, grippy red, with a tightly knit core boysenberry jam, pomegranate puree, wet earth and dried mint flavors. Fresh, offering a note of star anise on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,200 cases made.

name: Verona Costalago
review: Aromas of raisin, with hints of sun-dried tomato and Indian spices, follow through to a silky, medium- to full-bodied palate, with very fine tannins and violet and chocolate notes coming through the finish. This offers a subtle framework, but it's densely packed. An interesting new winery to follow. Corvina, Corvinone, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella
review: Slightly lean, with lots of toasty oak and sweet berry aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with firm tannins and a medium finish. A little bottle age should soften the roughness. Best after 2011. 1,665 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Tea leaf and dried fig notes lace the plumped cherry, spice and smoky mineral flavors in this lightly juicy, round and creamy Amarone. Medium-bodied and easy-drinking, with light tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 4,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: A modest, medium-bodied red, with light tannins and a creamy mix of dried strawberry and plumped cherry fruit, forest floor and tar notes, and accents of dark chocolate and spice. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: A crowd-pleasing red for its balance, medium body and appealing notes of plump cherry, fig cake and melted licorice, with hints of herb and cocoa powder, and soft, dusty tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Juicy blackberry and black cherry fruit is accented by light spice, mocha and smoke notes in this well-knit and balanced red. Modest tannins emerge on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 10,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Traditional, with lightly chewy tannins and more rich earth, dried herb and smoke notes than accents of black cherry and ripe plum. It's balanced and stays light on its feet, with a moderate finish. Drink now through 2017. 8,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Vigne Alte
review: Shows lots of dried dark fruits on the nose, with prune notes. Full-bodied, with slightly austere tannins and a candied dried fruit aftertaste. A little funky, but I like the richness. Some bottle age may bring this together better. Best after 2010.

name: Lugana Vigne Alte
review: Creamy and floral, this light- to medium-bodied white offers pleasing honeydew melon, apricot, candied ginger and slivered almond flavors enlivened by juicy acidity.  Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Moscato Rosa Trentino
review: Sweet-tart flavors of candied black cherry and raspberry mix in this aromatic dessert wine, along with hints of candied citrus peel and medicinal herbs. This is creamy, offering enough tangy acidity for focus. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Estate
review: Lithe, with a welcome sense of transparency to the cherry, caramel and sandalwood flavors, mingling gracefully on the long, appealing finish. Best from 2013 through 2019. 870 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Estate
review: Fresh and jazzy, with a sour candy edge to the blackberry and currant flavors, floating its aromatics over the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2018. 245 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Barrel Select
review: Fresh and vibrant, lively with strawberry, rhubarb and cherry pie flavors framed with a delicate, airy texture, lingering enticingly on the refined finish. Drink now through 2017. 120 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Barrel Select
review: Smooth and polished, jumping with blackberry, cherry and white pepper flavors that play against lively acidity as the finish lingers easily. Drink now through 2016. 257 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Reserve
review: Bright and lively, juicy, with berry and plum flavors that linger on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2004. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Soft around the edges, with crisp acidity under the melon and citrus flavors. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Barrel Select
review: Lithe, with a chalky edge to the lovely plum and orange peel flavors, finishing with delicacy. Needs time to soften. Best after 2012. 184 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Canterbury Reserve
review: Light and spicy, with pretty raspberry and cinnamon notes lingering on the graceful finish. Drink now through 2003. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Light and fragrant, with pretty raspberry and cherry flavors on a modest frame, echoing and expanding nicely on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Eola-Amity Hills
review: Light and spicy, with berry and black pepper flavors on a delicate frame, lingering gently. Drink now through 2015. 141 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light and polished in texture, with pretty lime and apple flavors. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light and refreshing for its crisp citrus and mineral flavors, echoing green apple on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Eola-Amity Hills
review: Tangy, with a soy sauce edge to the lemon and melon flavors, finishing with zip. Drink now. 178 cases made.

name: Merlot Hawkes Bay
review: Soft and supple, with pretty raspberry and leather character on a light finish. Drink now through 2004. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Estate
review: Gritty tannins grip the cherry and herb flavors. Best after 2014. 562 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills
review: Supple, open-textured and light-footed, with mineral-accented blackberry and spice flavors that dance through the taut finish. Shows presence and persistence. Drink now through 2021. 610 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Barrel Select
review: Firm, focused and expressive, with ripe currant and plum flavors, shaded with savory meat and peppery spice overtones, finishing with precision. Best from 2018 through 2024. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Estate
review: Light and sleek, with density to the coffee-scented blueberry and cherry fruit. The flavors dance through the finish against gently nubby tannins, lingering easily. Drink now through 2020. 490 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Barrel Select
review: Lithe and expressive, with taut, firm tannins around a glowing core of black cherry, red plum and floral spice flavors, singing through the nubby grip on the finish. Best from 2017 through 2020. 147 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Estate
review: Lithe and expressive, with a meaty edge to the rose petal-infused blackberry flavors, dancing deftly over powdery tannins into a long and refined finish. Best from 2018 through 2024. 610 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Barrel Select
review: Light and tangy, with a zingy feel to the red berry and floral flavors, fine tannins veiling the finish. Drink now through 2019. 147 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Shows wonderful purity of fruit, with ripe, rich, vivid blackberry, wild berry and cherry cola scents that are shaded by light toasty oak. Though it packs in lots of fruit, this is elegant and stylish, with excellent balance, depth and concentration. Drink now through 2011. 72 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: A classy Syrah, with rich, peppery wild berry and blackberry scents. Focused and tight, yet fleshy and supple, this is big and complex without being weighty. Has wonderful depth. Drink now through 2012. 60 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Openly ripe, rich and fruity, with generous plum, black cherry, spice and wilted rose flavors that are pure and persistent. Drink now through 2023. 268 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Supple and harmonious, with ripe, open-knit plum, black cherry, wild berry and spice, gaining depth and velocity and persisting on the finish. Drink now through 2023. 97 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley W.E. Bottoms Vineyard
review: Delicate, pure and focused, this wins you over with finesse and nuance. Full-bodied plum and black cherry fruit is well-centered, spicy and refreshing. Drink now through 2013. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Shows complex aromas of spice, raspberry and black cherry, with touches of wild berry, plum jam and loamy earth. Full-bodied, delicate and elegant, ending with a long, layered finish. Drink now through 2017. 312 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Creamy-textured, smooth and polished, with supple cranberry, blueberry and black cherry fruit that's ripe and polished, ending with a long, soothing finish that gains depth and complexity. Drink now through 2011. 103 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: Delightfully complex, with a mix of supple blueberry, wild berry, fresh roasted coffee and nutmeg-laced oak. While the entry is smooth, the tannins on the finish show some heft. Decant. Drink now through 2011. 40 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley W.E. Bottoms Vineyard
review: Pure, ripe and generous, with supple plum, wild berry and black cherry notes that are smooth, delicate and understated. Drink now through 2020. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Intense and racy, full-bodied and balanced, with zesty wild berry and blackberry fruit that has a nice floral, spice and nutmeg scent, smoothing out on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 110 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Intense and pleasantly earthy, this is full-bodied, with dried currant, wild berry, mineral, game and beef notes underneath. Needs a little time, but offers plenty of character and depth. Drink now through 2014. 97 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: Intense and spicy, with ground pepper, wild berry, sage and loamy earth flavors that are firm, full-bodied, focused and persistent, ending with a trim band of flavors. Drink now through 2016. 90 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: Full-bodied, firm and spicy, with a peppery rustic edge to the wild berry and dried currant. But this gains complexity and nuance, aided by a mineral and iron edge of earthiness. Well-structured. Drink now through 2013. 96 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Babushka
review: Ripe, juicy and complex pear, green apple, melon and spice notes are delicate. Medium-bodied, picking up touches of smoky oak and honeydew melon. Drink now through 2012. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Suacci Vineyard
review: Fragrant blueberry, blackberry and wild berry flavors are elegant yet intense, rich and well-proportioned, with detailed acidity, tannins and light oak. Finishes with a complex aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 75 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County
review: Exotic, showing vivid floral highlights of peach blossom and lime zest, with a zingy acidity. Finishes with bright mango notes. Drink now. 345 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Babushka
review: Complex and understated, showing a spicy Muscat-like scent that adds a nice touch to the ripe fig, pear and apple notes. Still raw in texture. Drink now through 2018. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Hanzell Vineyard
review: Rich and oaky in equal proportions, with subtle touches of peach, fig, apricot and smoke. Good length, but best to cellar short-term given the size and density of this version. Drink now through 2019. 98 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Trim and vibrant, with notes of red candy, anise, cedar and spice. Well-proportioned and focused, gaining on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 325 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Loamy earth, herb, sage and ripe plum and black cherry fruit is supple and complex, gaining depth and ending with a mix of mineral and fruit. Drink now through 2015. 270 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Barton Vineyard
review: Trim and spicy, with delicate spice, berry, cherry and plum flavors that are elegant and subtle, ending with a complex finish. Drink now through 2015. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley W.E. Bottoms Vineyard
review: A graceful, supple, harmonious style, with pleasing plum, black cherry and wild berry fruit that's focused and complex. Drink now through 2011. 148 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: A complex, delicate style, with dried berry, sage, mineral and cedar, ending a bit clipped. Drink now through 2022. 147 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Complex and supple, with a mix of smoky oak, ripe plum and sour cherry. Medium- to full-bodied, gaining depth and length on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 147 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Suacci Vineyard
review: A touch gamy, this full-bodied Pinot offers a nice mix of fresh earth, spice and sour black cherry fruit that's racy and wild, savory and complex. A bit unbridled at this point. Best from 2010 through 2015. 145 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Suacci Vineyard
review: Sleek and focused, with tart cherry and wild berry fruit that's fresh and lively. The excellent acidity gives this a fruity, cleansing aftertaste. Drink now through 2011. 72 cases made.

name: Rosé California
review: Delicate and quite lovely, with floral strawberry aromas that lead to crisp stone fruit and citrus flavors. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Pinot Noir. Drink now. 307 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Offers a flinty, stony mix of dried berry, herb, sage and cedar notes. This medium- to full-bodied red ends with a delicate aftertaste. Drink now through 2015. 247 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Nunes Vineyard
review: A bit simple, showing well-centered ripe plum and blackberry fruit that has a sour cherry edge. This is dry and gravelly on the finish, but short-term cellaring should round out the edges. Drink now through 2013. 98 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley W.E. Bottoms Vineyard
review: Firm and fleshy, with a mix of spice, cola, cherry and berry fruit that's well-focused, elegant and well-proportioned, ending with a mix of cola and rhubarb. Drink now through 2011. 71 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: A taut, firm, narrow style, where the tannins stand out, overshadowing the modest red and dark berry fruit. Drink now through 2020. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Focused on savory aromas, this shows an oakier profile on the palate, making it a good bet to cellar short term to let the fruit rise above the oakiness. Drink now through 2011. 90 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: There's lots of toasty, charry oak to work past at this stage, but also pleasant ripe cherry, currant and plum notes that will hopefully benefit from some bottle time. Best from 2009 through 2014. 137 cases made.

name: Rosé California
review: Modest in scale, but appealing for its notes of raspberry, spice and smoky herb. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Pinot Noir. Drink now. 414 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County
review: Whiffs of toasted nut and hay announce this wine, boasting plenty of peach, nectarine and pear flavors and a finish of spicy, juicy lemon. Drink now. 319 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California Risuena
review: Rustic in style, even a touch oxidized, this is more of a rich, gutsy red table wine than pure Pinot Noir. Drinks well nonetheless. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley W.E. Bottoms Vineyard
review: Supple, elegant cherry, raspberry and spice flavors are pure and delicate. Medium-weight and persistent, ending with a tart berry edge. Drink now through 2014. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: The understated plum and raspberry notes show a spicy, earthy, red licorice edge, ending with drying tannins that provide just enough intrigue. Drink now through 2020. 98 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Nunes Vineyard
review: A reticent style, offering a mix of modest ripe plum and wild berry, with loamy earth, dried herb and drying tannins. Drink now through 2017. 48 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: While moderately intense, this lacks focus, with cedary wood holding the upper hand against the light berry flavors. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Rosé California
review: Juicy and fresh, with modest cherry and vanilla notes. Pinot Noir. Drink now. 174 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Horse Heaven Hills Champoux Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with a buzz of tannins competing with ripe, focused black currant and floral flavors, lingering expressively. Needs time in the cellar to soften. Best after 2014. 367 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Cougar Vineyard
review: A sour edge makes this red less inviting, but the dark berry flavors contain some appeal. Drink now. 145 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley The Wild Sky
review: Lithe, elegant and refined, a majestic wine that refuses to go over the top, keeping its beautifully pointed currant, blackberry, coffee and chocolate flavors in check and letting them ooze through the long, polished finish. Drink now through 2017. 946 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley The Wild Sky
review: Polished, round and deftly balanced to play its rich, ripe black fruit flavors against elements of peppery spice, smoke and chocolate. Persists nicely on the soft finish. Drink now through 2012. 388 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley The Wild Sky
review: Warm and spicy, this graceful Cabernet features a chocolate note weaving through the blackberry and currant fruit, finishing with intensity and length. Hints of toast and pepper show around the edges. Drink now through 2018. 1,124 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley The Wild Sky
review: Firm in texture, with well-articulated dark berry, chocolate and floral flavors competing for attention, persisting impressively on the finish. Stylish and graceful, with flair. Best from 2012 through 2016. 709 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Wild Sky
review: Focused, deftly balanced and expressive, this sneaks up on you with tarry, minerally cherry and spice flavors on a medium-weight frame, lingering nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 954 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Golden Delicious
review: Bright and lively, this is polished in texture and vibrant with pretty pear and apple fruit, hinting at orchid notes as the off-dry finish lingers. Drink now through 2015. 478 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Golden Delicious
review: Bright and lively, with grapefruit and white peach notes competing for attention on a sleek frame, finishing just off-dry. Drink now through 2018. 336 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Golden Delicious
review: Soft and charming, off-dry but balanced, with lively acidity and restrained pear and floral flavors that echo hints of black tea and grapefruit peel on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2018. 315 cases made.

name: Sauce Columbia Valley
review: Sleek and expressive under a blanket of lightly scratchy tannins, offering layers of cocoa-accented black cherry, mint, floral and spice flavors, the texture resolving into airy plushness. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Best from 2018 through 2023. 1,018 cases made.

name: Merlot Blend Columbia Valley Sauce
review: Expressive, with a solid balance of ripe blueberry and currant fruit backed by refined tannins and a delicate lift of acidity. Merlot, Syrah and Malbec. Drink now through 2015. 1,029 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Golden Delicious
review: Pretty honeysuckle aromas lead to vibrant peach and lemon sorbet flavors that finish on a crisp note. Drink now. 315 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Golden Delicious
review: Light and deft in style, with taut acidity balancing the moderate sweetness. Offers pear, lime and lime blossom notes on a delicate flavor profile, lingering on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2017. 739 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Golden Delicious
review: Light and delicately sweet, offering pretty pear and floral aromas and flavors, balanced with a citrusy note, lingering gently. Drink now. 785 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Golden Delicious
review: Delicate and silky, with pear, lemon and floral aromas and flavors, lingering on the lightly sweet, focused finish. Drink now. 504 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Parison
review: There's a minty edge to the pear and spice flavors in this fresh, lively white, lingering nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 167 cases made.

name: Sauce Washington
review: Supple, refined and appealing in the way it plays out its flavors, striking a balance between tobacco and earth flavors and currant and blackberry fruit, finishing gracefully. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2015. 987 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley Copper Lily
review: Light and fragrant, with hints of peach amid the grapefruit and pear flavors. Drink now. 312 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley The Wild Sky
review: Firm in texture, offering chewy tannins around a sleek core of cocoa- and coffee-accented currant and cedar flavors, coming together with point on the finish. Best from 2018 through 2021. 300 cases made.

name: Sauce Columbia Valley
review: Light and refreshing, with pretty raspberry and floral flavors on an open-textured frame. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 945 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley Copper Lily
review: Crisp and discreet, with pear and grapefruit accents. Drink now. 336 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Smooth, polished, ripe, complex cherry, currant, coffee and cedar, adding a nice dose of smoky, buttery oak. Shows great finesse and grace for a new red of this proportion. 300 cases made.

name: Mia Madre Napa Valley
review: Plump, rich and fleshy, with a core of currant, black licorice, spice, earth and light cedary oak notes, ending clean and spicy. Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Mia Madre Napa Valley
review: Balances fruit intensity, focus and freshness with depth and nuance, showing hints of dark berry, cherry, anise and light cedary oak. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: A bold, rich, extracted style, with dense, meaty blackberry and wild berry fruit that's deep and intense. Ends with loamy earth, reverberating with dark berry fruit. Firmly tannic. Drink now through 2021. 325 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros
review: Mixes complex ripe black cherry, mineral, anise and sage with taut, firm tannins, slowly revealing a core of richness and a suppleness in texture. Gains depth and length. 200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Mango, pineapple and fresh lime flavors really pop here, set on a smooth, crisp body, with good intensity. Juicy and lingering on the finish, with a note of orange zest. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Firm and well-built, with a core of spicy, anise-laced red and dark berry flavors, ending with firm, gravelly tannins that have a pleasant earthiness. Drink now through 2022. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Dense and earthy, with tough-edged tannins that overshadow the otherwise supple and graceful plum and black cherry fruit. The tannins should fade. Ends with a gravelly edge. Drink now through 2022. 220 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Smooth and succulent, with plenty of power to the lemon, peach, pineapple, lemon verbena and grapefruit flavors. Very juicy and refreshing, finishing light and crisp. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: A refreshing mix of Key lime, passion fruit and guava flavors are delicate and detailed, with a mouthwatering acidity, a light body and a mineral edge. There's a slightly coarse finish. Drink now through 2014. 252 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Green Valley of Russian River Valley Chenoweth Vineyard
review: Intense, with vibrant, if raw and edgy, tannins amid the firm blackberry, spice, anise, cedar, black licorice, cola and savory herb notes. Everything is in place, though the tannins are biting. Drink now through 2021. 240 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Fresh and refreshing, with cut grass, thyme and a hint of jalapeño pepper lending definition to the crisp lemon, grapefruit and apple flavors. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Oakville
review: Chewy and earthy, with a focused core of dried berry and herb. This is savory, ending dry and tannic. Drink now through 2020. 125 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Old Vine
review: Supple and zesty, with black cherry and mocha aromas and modest plum, orange rind and espresso flavors. Drink now through 2014. 921 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Appealing for its spicy dill and cherry aromas and dried plum and licorice flavors. Best after 2014. 527 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape Great White Wines
review: Soft and simple, with faint apple and butter notes. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape Great White Wines
review: Light, with modest peach flavor and a diffuse finish. Clean and simple. 700 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape Great White Wines
review: Shows a mix of earth and paraffin, with a blowsy finish. 400 cases made.

name: Muscat Canelli Yakima Valley
review: Sweet, fruity and beguiling. This swirls its spicy pear, litchi and citrus flavors in an attractive pattern. A lovely dessert wine. 250 cases made.

name: Sémillon Yakima Valley
review: Light, lean and crisp, vibrant, sporting citrusy pear flavor. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Aligoté Yakima Valley
review: Crisp, refreshing, lively apple and citrus flavors, finishing simple and clean as a whistle. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Definitely sweet but light in texture, sporting honey, earth, tobacco and pear flavors that are more like Sémillon than Riesling. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Yakima Valley
review: Frankly herbal, showing earth, mineral and berry flavors that get a little tough on the finish. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: A racy style, with apple, peach and lime notes mingling with the light texture. Fine length, with candied apple and caramel. Complex and long, exhibiting more verve than most 2005 BAs. A long-distance runner. 8 cases imported.

name: Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Electric, this wraps its lemon-lime, dried apricot and mineral flavors around a core of acidity. Sleek and intense, with precision balance and a long, mouthwatering finish. Best from 2009 through 2050. 8 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel Rausch
review: Very racy and pure-tasting, with loads of concentrated ruby grapefruit, peach, apricot and pear tart flavors that display refined power. Really hums on the finish, with loads of buttercream, honey and spice. A beautifully elegant auslese. Drink now through 2040. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Vanilla cream, Key lime pie and peach cobbler aromas and flavors meld nicely, all underscored by the bracing structure in this lighter-than-air white. Terrific balance and harmony will allow this to develop for decades. Best from 2012 through 2042. 20 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Exotic, with botrytis lending a spicy, candylike edge to the dried quince, pear and citrus flavors. Very tight now, with the structure dominating, but there's a burning kernel of fruit and mineral at the core. Best from 2009 through 2030. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Wonderful clarity and expression of pear and apple flavors, with a seamless structure and texture. Honey and a touch of mineral on the finish round out the flavor profile. Fine length. Drink now through 2020. 20 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: There's fine intensity to the candied citrus and berry flavors, with a honey and spice element that suggests botrytis. The acidity keeps it defined and mouthwatering, with fine length. Wrapped up tight now, this needs a few years. Best from 2009 through 2030. 15 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
Riesling Eiswein Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: (Auction wine). Combines wonderful floral, apricot, lime and mineral aromas and flavors with a dense, succulent texture and racy structure in a seductive, harmonious presentation. Needs some time to integrate the acidity. Best from 2002 through 2015. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: (Auction wine). Pear, honeysuckle, apricot and chamomile notes with a hint of botrytis reveal themselves on a gossamer framework, pulsing through the finish, thanks to the vibrant structure. Fine length. Best from 2004 through 2015. 25 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Spiced pear, lime and golden raisin notes swirl around a laserlike structure that keeps this centered. A racy style, with less concentration, yet showing plenty of intensity and a lovely lime and slate aftertaste. Best from 2010 through 2030. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: A hidden monster. Compact and thick, with loads of fruit, but closed in. Needs time to develop in the glass. Full-bodied and sweet, with subdued mineral, lime and lemon aromas and flavors, extremely steely acidity and a compact fruit structure. Drink now through 1998.

name: Riesling Auslese Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: A terrific dessert wine, with racy spicy, mineral and sweet fruit character. Full-bodied and sweet yet with an impressive undercarriage of steely acidity. Built for aging. Try now or hold.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Rausch
review: A crunchy and rich white, filled with apple pastry and plum tart flavors that feature hints of white pepper. Racy midpalate, showing citrusy accents. Finishes with notes of ruby grapefruit, spice and white chocolate. Best from 2018 through 2036. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Rausch
review: Creamy and lush up front, with notes of honeysuckle and jasmine to the tangerine, red peach and Anjou pear flavors. The generously spiced finish is loaded with phyllo pastry and baklava notes that give this an elegant allure. Drink now through 2040. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ockfener Bockstein
review: This is tight now, with lime, stone and smoke flavors locked within the bracing structure. That's a good sign for this 2005, because there's plenty of concentration. Has fine length. Best from 2010 through 2030. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Tasty, yet it seems like there's some development. Starting to show beeswax and honey along with vanilla and citrus, this is also full of stone, with a long finish. Drink now through 2035. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: (Auction wine). A charmer. Suave and supple, this exhibits peach, nectarine and lime aromas and flavors in a soft, easygoing presentation. Firm underlying acidity keeps it fresh and long, but it needs a bit of time to marry with the sweetness. Best from 2003 through 2012. 30 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Very racy style of BA, more like an eiswein, with loads of ripe lemon and orange character. Full-bodied yet delicate and balanced, with a long, fresh finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Eiswein Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch (AP 1)
review: (Auction wine). Utterly seductive aromas and flavors of rose, red berry and citrus blossom are packed into a slim, racy frame, with plenty of tart acidity refreshing the finish. Best from 2001 through 2010.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Rausch
review: Concentrated flavors of red peach, apple and pear mix effortlessly in this light and creamy style. Features plenty of fresh acidity, with a broad finish that delivers notes of sage honey and slate. Drink now through 2034. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Rausch
review: Quite crunchy and fruity, with tangerine, dried quince and kumquat flavors. The racy finish offers notes of dried basil and lemon verbena, showing some creamy accents. An expressive style. Drink now through 2035. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Rausch
review: Opulent and ripe, with lush, concentrated flavors of apricot, apple strudel and Key lime pie. There's a powerful minerality and acidity to this wine, which finishes with notes of honey cream and lemon meringue. Drink now through 2030.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Rausch
review: A zesty and savory style, with bright dried sage, orange peel and green apple flavors, supported by fresh acidity. Very flinty on the finish, with saline and white pepper notes. Drink now through 2038. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Saarburger Rausch
review: Very focused, with rich, luscious and vibrant flavors of ginger cream, spiced peach, apricot tart and spiced pear. Creamy notes linger on the long, juicy finish, which features minerally hints. Drink now through 2040. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Well-defined and elegant, displaying balance and harmony. Creamy, with apricot, spice and slate notes. The acidity dovetails nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Eiswein Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch (AP 2)
review: A suave eiswein, whose orange-tinged and floral notes are accented by a mineral and smoke element, all buoyed by a bracing structure that leaves a distinctively tart impression on the finish. Best from 2002 through 2012.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Rausch
review: This features racy minerality to the rich flavors of red peach, apricot and lemon tart. Very plush midpalate, with a creamy finish filled with spice. Drink now through 2023. 600 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Intriguing. From the red-fruit aromas and pomegranate flavors to the pineapplelike bite and sleek framework, this is a winner. Really packs a lot of flavor into its compact frame. Great finish. Drink now through 2006. 220 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch (AP 4)
review: Very creamy in texture, with hints of herbs and red fruits lending distinction to this expressive white. Good concentration and a lingering aftertaste of orange. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: (Auction wine). Thyme and apricot make for an interesting marriage of flavors in this gum-searing, densely textured auslese. Really high-pitched and tightly coiled, with a ton of slate on the finish. Best from 2001 through 2010.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: A fine, elegant auslese, with peach, apple and mineral aromas and flavors. Full-bodied and very firm, with fresh acidity and fruit on the aftertaste. Drinkable now or hold.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch (AP 3)
review: (Auction wine). Wonderful harmony, richness and structure. Still young and unevolved, with classic Mosel flavors of lime, peach and mineral, finishing with a hint of orange. The flavors have intensity, concentration and length. Drink now through 2010. 70 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Rausch
review: Exotic and tropical, with concentrated dried mango and guava flavors that are joined by glazed apricot notes. Features some savory accents that linger on the finish. Drink now through 2032.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Has electrifying acidity. Medium-bodied and very sweet, with powerful honey, passion fruit and lemon rind aromas, very high acidity and a sweet-and-sour finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ockfener Bockstein
review: Elegant and spicy, this white exhibits candied lime, spice apple and mineral aromas and flavors on a light-bodied frame. Needs some time to harmonize, so be patient. Drink now through 2022. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Delicate and spice-infused, showing peach, nectarine and slate flavors allied to a vibrant, steely structure. This has cut and dimension, lingering with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2022. 600 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: This has personality and flair. Exotic, showing tropical fruit, custard, lime and mineral flavors embedded in the creamy texture. Bright acidity keeps it all focused through the long finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Mosel Rausch Diabas
review: There's good power behind the ginger, ripe honeydew melon and pear flavors, displaying notes of star fruit and savory herb. Delivers a vibrant structure, with a crystalline finish of mineral and spice. Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Mosel Rausch GG
review: Offers a fruity nose, with ripe apple, cherry and white raspberry flavors that are matched to flinty notes. Rich tropical accents chime in, presenting a finish filled with citrus zest and spice. Fresh and pure. Best from 2018 through 2023. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Rausch
review: Juicy, with well-defined apricot, ripe apple and pear flavors that are flanked by notes of honey and cream. Fresh and pure-tasting finish features hints of smoke. Drink now through 2028. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Saarburger Rausch
review: Round, yet offset by a piquant acidity, this sports lime, herb and vanilla notes. Borders on creamy, staying fresh and lively on the finish. Delicious midpalate, with a Granny Smith aftertaste. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases imported.

name: Viognier Victoria
review: Ripe, round and deliciously exotic, offering creamy pear, guava, passion fruit and lemon custard flavors that spill enticingly through the long, silky finish. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Victoria Selection 23
review: Tangy and bright, zingy with acidity and nicely layered with pear, citrus and spice flavors, persisting through the lively finish. Drink now through 2006. 12,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Victoria
review: Bright and juicy, with fine tannins around a core of blackberry, red cherry and white pepper flavors, lingering nicely on the lively finish. Drink now through 2007. 300,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Victoria Selection 23
review: Smooth, with appealing currant and plum fruit, shaded with earthy, peppery notes. Drink now through 2007. 80,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Victoria
review: Soft, bordering on sweet, with herbal cherry flavors that linger. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Victoria
review: Earthy and sour. Not a pleasant drink. 300,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Kremstal Kremser Gebling
review: A bit closed right now, but shows the density and structure of a great vintage, finishing with tangy acidity. The flavors are celery, lemon and mineral. Best after 1999. 133 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Kremstal Rohrendorfer Rosshimmel
review: Distinctive, showing marzipan, beeswax and nectarine flavors on a thick, rich texture that turns dry and tart on the finish. Needs to open up. Best after 1999. 80 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Kremstal Gedersdorfer Gernlüssen
review: Very dry, with almond and apple flavors and a touch of citrus that lingers on the finish. Medium-bodied, with a hint of bitterness at the end. A good match for food. Drink now. 415 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Beacon Hill Vineyard
review: Firm and generous, light-footed and rich, with currant and dark plum flavors dancing against refined tannins as the finish glints with caramel and floral notes. Drink now through 2020. 111 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills La Colina Vineyard
review: Light and distinctive, offering cinnamon and whole-grain accents to the blueberry and cherry flavors, which dance lightly through the finish. Drink now through 2015. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Lithe, complex and distinctive, with a meaty note that runs through the cherry and spice flavors, lingering against mildly scratchy tannins. Has presence and length, in a savory style. Drink now through 2020. 190 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills La Colina Vineyard
review: Ripe and rich, featuring a bitter note that sneaks in with the sassafras and smoke undertones to the dark berry flavors. Firm tannins mark the finish. Best from 2013 through 2018. 134 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: This ripe style offers cherry and wet earth flavors on a crisp, slightly grippy layer of tannins. Needs time to soften around edges. Best from 2014 through 2017. 232 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Light and tight, with a crisp feel to the orange peel, tea and cherry flavors. Persistent finish. Drink now through 2015. 100 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Tart and lean, with modest cherry aromas and lots of herbal flavors. Drink now. 990 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Clos Windsbuhl Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Like liquid candy, this is a mouthful of apricot, quince, coconut, honey and smoke flavors matched to a thick texture and vibrant structure. Despite the concentration, it melts in the mouth, as the acidity takes over from the initial sweetness. Incredibly long butterscotch aftertaste. Drink now through 2025. 55 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Clos Jebsal Trie Spéciale Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Exotic and smoky. Unctuous in texture and very complex. Dried apricot, spice, honey and floral aromas and flavors mesh seamlessly with the vibrant structure. Stays focused and balanced from start to finish, with lingering accents of dried orange peel and honey. Drink now through 2030. 15 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: This lip-smacking version presents a refined tapestry, with layers of tangerine, mango puree, apricot pie and toasty praline flavors, offset by a rich vein of smoky mineral and intriguing accents of fleur de sel, shredded coconut and candied ginger. Shows harmonious integration of the laserlike acidity. Drink now through 2050. 91 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Clos Jebsal Trie Spéciale Sélection des Grains Nobles Todd
review: Impressive for its concentration and thick texture, but without the nuance of the Trie Spéciale. Masses of dried apricot, orange, honey and delicate spice flavors still mingle and wash away on the lengthy finish. A hint of hard lemon candy in the aftertaste. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2040.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Trie Spéciale Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Lush, with mouthwatering acidity and the melt-in-your-mouth texture of cotton candy. This finely balanced SGN offers pure fruit flavors of apricot, peach skin and guava, with accents of rose petal and chamomile, balanced by rich layers of spun honey, furniture polish, coconut and vanilla. Features a lasting, spiced finish. Drink now through 2040. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Trie Spéciale Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: An SGN with a lot of color—deep amber—and a multitude of flavor, delivering layers of ripe yellow peach, mango, crystallized honey and candied citrus peel, with hints of vanilla, iodine, espresso and bourbon. Rich and round, with a melt-in-your-mouth texture, but superbly balanced by intense, mouthwatering acidity. The extremely long finish shows a briny mineral note that's a fine counterpoint to the wine's ripe, honeyed fruit character. Drink now through 2040. 95 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Very aromatic, with cardamom and fennel notes underscoring layers of rose petal, candied grapefruit peel, honeysuckle, blood orange and just a touch of lychee. Deftly put together, with crackling acidity framing the wine and smoky minerality running throughout. Shows beautiful balance. Drink now through 2035. 47 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl Trie Spéciale Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Very spicy and rich, with clove, nutmeg, cardamom and white pepper notes winding through flavors of baked apricot, spun honey, bergamot and pastry. Though lush and mouthcoating, this features racy, well-meshed acidity that creates a mouthwatering impression on the extended finish. To be released fall 2013. Drink now through 2030.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: All the elements of this dessert white are coming together to create an appealing, harmonious whole. Concentrated and lush, with a silky texture, vibrant acidity and apricot, lychee, honey and spice notes. Has terrific class, with a lingering finish. Best from 2012 through 2050. 130 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: A seductive mouthful of smoke, apricot, orange marmalade and honey ride a bright structure and smooth texture in this seamless SGN. Concentrated, yet seemingly lighter than air, the finish goes on and on. Drink now through 2025. 85 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Trie Spéciale Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Rich and concentrated, with pretty floral notes highlighting the almond, treacle, dried papaya and smoke. This is soft and lush, but with good acidity for balance and a long finish of smoky roasted nuts. Drink now through 2019. 175 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Lush flavors of candied orange peel, rose petal, honeycomb and spice mix in this creamy, mouthcoating wine. The acidity here is firm, but very subtle, and a smoky thread weaves through the wine to the long, peach-tinged finish. Drink now through 2024. 42 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert Vendange Tardive
review: A rich, powerful wine, fragrant with honey, guava, apricot, spice and smoke aromas and flavors. It softens across the palate, revealing a silky texture and ample acidity to keep it fresh and lively on the finish. Think foie gras or Muenster cheese. Drink now through 2012. 175 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert Vendange Tardive
review: Compelling, undeniable Gewürztraminer. Sweet and rich, abundant flavor and a thick, pleasingly unctuous texture with great acidity to keep it fresh on the palate and the finish. Delicious now, but it's still a baby, and will be more interesting if cellared until about 2000. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl Trie Spéciale Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: This amber-colored SGN is loaded with herb and spice accents—nutmeg, myrrh, clove and Chartreuse-like medicinal herbs—that add detail to flavors of peach and apricot jam, apple sauce, honeycomb, sweet smoke and spiced nuts. A thick, unctuous wine, but very bright and tangy nonetheless, with a fine backbone of intense acidity. A unique expression of both grape and style. Offers more with each sip. Drink now through 2027. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl Trie Spéciale Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Hints of curry spice and cinnamon weave through the layers of tropical fruits--mango, papaya and guava--and notes of roasted almond, honeycomb and toffee. Subtly integrated acidity drives this seamless wine and powers it through to the long, smoke-tinged finish. Drink now through 2030. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Beautifully balanced and mouthwatering, with vibrant acidity providing a fine, chinalike backbone for the finely meshed flavors of baked peach, orange granita and white cherry fruit, graced by rich accents of crystallized honey, beeswax and praline. Brings you back for another sip. Drink now through 2036. 83 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: A concentrated sweet white exuding honey, caramel, apricot and orange peel aromas and flavors that orbit around a core of bright acidity. Seamless in texture and structure, with a caressing finish. Drink now through 2015. 130 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Trie Spéciale Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: This offers a heady nose, akin to a rose garden after the rain, and melts on your tongue with the texture of spun honey. Finely balanced, with a rich and smoky flavor profile offering notes of baked peach, pecan pie, beeswax, lemon meringue and candied ginger. Drink now through 2035. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Ripe mango, pineapple and star fruit notes play off just a hint of fresh, earthy mushroom in this vibrant version, which shows zesty, enlivening acidity that provides lots of muscle, though there's a lightly mouthcoating texture that's like a layer of silk on the palate. Finely tuned. Drink now through 2030. 140 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: This is a textbook example of what fine Gewürztraminer can be, driven by intense, lip-smacking acidity and displaying classic lychee, cream and rose petal notes, as well as blood orange and red grapefruit flavors. A briny minerality runs through the wine, and the smoky finish goes on and on. Drink now through 2020. 90 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Rich and dry, with smoky minerality and nervy acidity providing more firm structure right now than flesh. But notes of yellow peach, fennel seed, candied orange peel and curry spices hint at the abundant flavor profile to come as the wine ages and opens up. Delicious, with a long life ahead of it. Best from 2011 through 2030. 168 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: This puts it all together. Gorgeous aromas and flavors of tropical fruit, honey, smoke and mineral permeate the lush texture, all supported by a firm, bright acidity. Though full-bodied and almost fat, it never gets heavy; in fact, it's harmonious. A long finish caps it off. Best from 2005 through 2015. 1,050 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain Vendange Tardive
review: Loads of botrytis. Honey, crème brûlée, grapefruit and passion fruit mingle in this exotic, hedonistic white. Yet there's purity at the core. Dense and structured, this has the components for the long haul. There's some heat on the finish, but overall, this is very well-balanced. Best from 2004 through 2015. 100 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Mango, peach and pineapple notes are layered with hints of orange candy, cherry pit, basil and earth in this intriguing wine. The silky texture sits on a medium-bodied frame, with bright acidity for balance that leads to a long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2035. 45 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Herrenweg Vendange Tardive Vieilles Vignes
review: Lacy in texture and seamlessly integrated, this off-dry, lightly honeyed version features racy acidity, providing fine balance and enlivening notes of mango puree, lychee, grapefruit granita, honeycomb and apricot. Hints of smoke and wax linger on the lush, mineral-driven finish. Drink now through 2030. 40 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: The crackling acidity is matched in intensity by the pronounced tea rose note that wafts through this vibrant white. Peach and papaya flavors play off smoke and white pepper notes, lingering on the long, mouthwatering finish. This is delicious, and each sip brings you back for another. Drink now through 2030. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Deeply colored, exhibiting a panoply of aromas and flavors, including jasmine, honeysuckle, dried apricot, dried orange peel, smoke, mineral and mushroom, with hints of clove and myrrh. This is set on a solid framework, with vibrant acidity to balance the richness, offering more with each sip. The long finish alternates between the pretty floral and fruit notes and hints of smoky forest floor. Drink now through 2029. 667 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Stunning. Effusive aromas of guava, honey, orange peel and smoke burst forth from the glass. On the palate, it's lush and creamy, underscored by firm acidity and a slight walnutty bitterness that plays off the lingering sweetness. Tremendous harmony and length. Drink now through 2005.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: A focused SGN, with tangy acidity that really brightens flavors of quince paste, crystallized honey, lemon meringue pie, with a pretty floral note. Very juicy and finely balanced, with a hint of salty minerality that builds toward the long finish. Drink now through 2034. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive
review: Beautifully textured and lacy, with nuances of orange, apricot, honey and buttery pastry. Elegant yet concentrated, with a grapefruit peel lift on the finish. Harmonious and approachable, yet should age well. Drink now through 2030. 375 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Intense aroma of dried pear, followed by an elegant sweet white with honey spice and more pear flavors. It's all backed by lively structure, keeping the whole presentation balanced and long on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Extremely concentrated, so thick it's hard to swallow its spicy crème brûlée, dried coconut, ripe melon, even white truffle, flavors. Yet despite its ripe power, it's not cloyingly sweet; the balance is rock solid. Delicous now, but will improve for years.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: A honeyed style, this is very concentrated and lush, with apricot, clover honey, passion fruit and grapefruit flavors as it unfolds across the palate. Racy, finishing clean as a whistle despite its obvious sweetness. Best from 2008 through 2040. 90 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Alluring coconut and banana aromas promise a party, and the palate delivers with a sweet, yet spicy character that explodes with flavor. Though very sweet, it has balancing notes of dried pineapple acidity and rose petal bitterness that keep it focused and interesting. Enjoy it now or cellar for years.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Vendange Tardive Vieilles Vignes
review: Intense and focused, this finely balanced wine offers layers of peach compote, spun honey, papaya, pickled ginger and poached pear flavors wrapped around a core of minerality and meshed with razor-sharp acidity. The mouthwatering finish echoes the ripe fruit notes along with a hint of fleur de sel. Drink now through 2030. 60 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Wintzenheim Rotenberg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Plush and mouthcoating, yet never heavy, this dessert white vibrates with spice, honey and dried tropical fruit. Really intense and focused on the palate, with enough acidity to drive the flavors to a long conclusion. Long aftertaste of mint and honey. Drink now through 2020. 140 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Wintzenheim Rotenberg Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: An opulent dessert wine, with Earl Grey and orange peel notes playing off baked peach, orange coulis, vanilla and honey flavors. The mouthwatering acidity shows precision balance, subtly driving this rich wine, which ends with a lingering, caramel-tinged finish. Drink now through 2030.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Wintzenheim Rotenberg Vendange Tardive
review: A big wine, seemingly soft at first, with an open-knit texture, but the acidity emerges midpalate and picks up steam toward the finish. It all serves as a well-defined backdrop for the intense peach, apricot and pineapple flavors. Lovely mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2015. 80 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: A rich, juicy white, with crackling acidity winding through the mango, ripe apple, peach and orange candy. An exuberant wine, with lots of power and intensity, but produced in an overall elegant package. Subtle threads of smoke and crushed pine add complexity and linger on the long finish. Drink now through 2030. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: A vibrant white, crackling with a light saber of acidity that defines the flavors of nectarine, melon, grated ginger and star anise, revealing a tangy, saline-tinged undertow. Finely knit and long, with the fruit and mineral notes echoing on the finish. Drink now through 2035. 320 cases made.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Extremely sweet and incredibly concentrated, with thick but light texture. Complex aromas of toast, crème brûlée and apricot; flavors of honey, vanilla, pear and peach. The finish is clean, long and expansive. Delicious now, but should improve through at least 1998, if you can stand to wait. 75 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert Vendange Tardive
review: Zesty acidity and spice drive the papaya, tangelo and pink grapefruit flavors of this focused VT. It's set into an elegant frame, and a classic lychee note echoes on the long, tangy finish. This would be a great partner for foie gras or pâté. Drink now through 2023. 200 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert Vendange Tardive
review: Magnificent intensity and even some elegance characterize this unbelievably rich, dry, full-bodied wine. Marvelously complex, with apricot, pear, rose petal and spice, appreciable subtlety and great length.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Rich and vibrant, with flavors of peaches and cream, grapefruit granita, Key lime pie, ground anise and candied ginger, all backed by firm acidity and a smoky, minerally underpinning. Full-bodied and intense, this wine needs food or time in the cellar. Best from 2017 through 2030. 150 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Beautifully aromatic and finely balanced, with ample ground spice and floral notes. The laserlike acidity creates a firm, crystalline frame for the flavors, with peach skin, guava, clover honey and fleur de sel. A pronounced vein of smoky mineral resonates on the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2030. 150 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: A nose of smoke and mineral translates to the palate in this powerful Gewürztraminer, accenting a wide array of flavors-papaya, candied orange peel, blood orange, crystallized honey, lychee and spring blossoms, with hints of toffee and cumin. Backed by finely tuned, vibrant acidity, which tilts this toward the dry side and creates a long, mouthwatering impression on the tightly knit finish. Drink now through 2029. 200 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst
review: Vibrant, defined as much by the spiced mineral character as by its rich, ripe baked peach, guava and honey flavors, showing intriguing accents of Thai basil, cumin and ginger. Luxuriantly mouthcoating and silky, but the piercing acidity imparts lovely balance through the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2030. 220 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Lovely and expressive, with lots of Gewürztraminer's lychee, orange blossom, cream and honeysuckle flavors. Zesty acidity runs through this, and this vibrant framework really allows the purity of flavor to shine. The long finish is infused with rose petal. Drink now through 2030. 120 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst Vendange Tardive
review: There's lovely balance to this floral version, lightly sweet and creamy on the palate, offering a well-cut vein of citrusy acidity that frames the flavors of cantaloupe, lychee, honeyed apricot and star fruit. A streak of zesty ground ginger and white pepper builds on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 30 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst Vendange Tardive
review: This rich VT is saturated with a candied orange peel flavor, along with pomegranate, clove, nutmeg and lychee notes. Big and intense, with a racy acidity and a long, lingering finish that's layered with cream, honey and spice.  Drink now through 2030. 150 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst Vendange Tardive
review: An exotic, elegant, beautifully defined Gewürz that is flavorful and vibrant, yet delicate in its floral, spice and pear flavors. Sweet but not cloying, exquisitely smooth, long-lasting on the finish. Great to drink now, but can stay in the cellar until at least 1998 if you like more mature flavors. 300 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: Beautifully balanced and racy, with searing acidity providing a firm backbone for the finely knit flavors of papaya, apricot tart, orange peel, aromatic smoke, anise and ground cardamom. This offers a lightly honeyed, lasting finish that echoes the fruit character. Drink now through 2025. 45 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: This rich Gewürztraminer is just off-dry. Honey and floral notes accent flavors of beeswax, lychee and lemon curd, while a firm backbone of acidity provides structure. A mouthwatering, elegant wine, with complex layers and a long finish. Drink now through 2028.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: A delicious white, concentrated and expressive, offering mango, litchi, apricot and mineral aromas and flavors, all kept focused by the vibrant structure. It picks up a characteristic grapefruit peel note on the finish, which goes on and on. Best from 2005 through 2012. 330 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive
review: Distinctive, boasting lychee, grape and spice flavors. On the sweet side, this gets a counterpoint from the bitter grapefruit peel element as much as the acidity. There's fine balance and length overall, with a cleansing aftertaste. Break out the Muenster. Drink now through 2025. 390 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg
review: This elegant wine layers Gewürztraminer's typical rose petal, lychee and spice notes with flavors of orange, spice and cream. Seamless wine, with an ethereal texture and well-honed balance that offers more with each sip. Smoky finish. Drink now through 2025. 308 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg Vendange Tardive
review: Opulent and aromatic, with concentration and notes of pineapple, apricot and honey, with a hint of green tea. There's an intensity as well as a vibrant structure, so be patient for a year or two.  Best from 2005 through 2015. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: A seamless Pinot Gris, with broad shoulders and a powerful acidic frame belied by an overall harmony and sense of finesse, this offers a vibrant mix of baked peach, lychee, candied orange zest and star anise notes underscored by a rich streak of smoky mineral. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2035. 490 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: A well-cut, dry version, with a stony mineral undertow and aromatic hints of rose petal, lychee and fresh ground pink peppercorn accenting the finely knit flavors of melon, white peach, kumquat and blanched almond. Accents of ground spice echo on the lasting finish. Drink now through 2028. 60 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Racy acidity frames this white, driving white peach, kumquat, star fruit and cantaloupe flavors, with a rich, smoky subnote. Very refined and well-cut, with all the details attended to. The lingering finish echoes the wine's smoky mineral side, with a pretty floral note of orchard blossoms. Drink now through 2030. 670 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Despite a deep, burnished gold hue, this big white is fresh and dry, with appealing apple blossom and honey notes mixing with orange marmalade, smoke and spice flavors. The intense acidity provides ample backbone, and leads to a long, mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2030. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain Sélection de Grains Nobles
