review: Pushes the envelope with its high-toned, dried tropical fruit. Coconut, pineapple, apricot and caramel all hold court. Thickly textured and lively, the flavors segue into an intriguing caramel and white chocolate finish. Drink now through 2008.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Clos Jebsal Vendange Tardive
review: Heady, with loads of honey, apricot and caramel corn notes. Moderately sweet, concentrated and a little raw today, so give it about five years. The aroma is really singing, but the palate needs time to align itself. Best from 2008 through 2020. 430 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: There's lovely balance and focus to this creamy and mouthwatering white, with a waxy edge to the ripe flavors of baked peach, mango chutney, lemon meringue pie, smoke and crystallized honey. Dried herb and ground spice notes add to the aromatic profile, lingering on the long, rich finish. Drink now through 2028. 40 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: Rich and compact, with tightly knit layers of yellow peach, star fruit, kumquat, melon, beeswax and ground ginger flavors that gain intensity from a laser beam of acidity. Finely meshed and refined in texture, but nonetheless powerful all the way through to the lingering, spice-tinged finish. Drink now through 2027.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: Ripe flavors of yellow peach, melon, clementine and honey are well-balanced by the firm acidity and notes of white pepper and smoke. An intense, layered wine, still tightly knit right now, hinting at a long future. Best from 2012 through 2030. 470 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: A powerful, flamboyant white, this is lush and exotic in texture and flavor, sporting apricot, warm brioche, butter and mineral aromas and flavors, all supported by a lively structure and a hint of astringency on the finish. A wine for rich food. Best from 2005 through 2008. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: Backward and restrained, but it evokes a strong mineral component that weaves throughout this powerful, classy white. Peach, quince and smoke flavors add complexity. On the dry side, with wonderful balance and a long finish. Best from 2004 through 2012. 295 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Ripe and focused, layered with lots of fruit flavors—papaya, pineapple and peach jam—as well as notes of hard candy and smoke and hints of cardamom. Razor-sharp acidity pulls it all into balance and tames some of the opulence, leaving a long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2028. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Rich and concentrated, displaying fleshy yellow peach, quince paste and papaya notes, along with smoke, honeysuckle and gingerbread spices. Live-wire acidity drives this wine, leading to a long, tangy finish. Drink now through 2025. 58 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Vendange Tardive
review: A sweet, smoky thread winds through this, accenting the baked peach, cardamom, papaya, candied blood orange and crushed pine needle notes. A finely layered wine, subtly weaving in the powerful acidity, while the smoke note gains intensity toward the stony, mineral-driven finish. A lot of power partnered with equal finesse. Drink now through 2030. 160 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Vendange Tardive
review: Seductively aromatic, wafting come-hither aromas and flavors of honeysuckle, ripe peach, candied orange peel, mineral and smoke toward the nose and palate. Though lush, this is supported by nervy acidity that keeps it fresh. The long finish shows lots of smoke and white pepper. Drink now through 2025. 208 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Packed with botrytis, lending concentration and honey, dried fruit and citrus notes, this has lively acidity and a thick texture, yet retains freshness and elegance. Still, it's monolithic in flavor now; needs time to show its multifaceted character. Best from 2005 through 2020. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg Vendange Tardive
review: Lush, billowy and voluminous with its apricot, mango, guava and pastry flavors, yet maintaining a sense of grace, plying its flavors on a silky texture. Great length and persistence on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 105 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Vieilles Vignes
review: This is just off-dry, with honey and orange peel flavors wrapped around the yellow peach, hard candy and candle wax notes. A rich wine, but offers plenty of juicy acidity and zesty spice notes to provide balance. Delicious, with a very long finish. Drink now through 2025. 130 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Wintzenheim Rotenberg Vendange Tardive
review: Packed with botrytized flavors, apricot, grapefruit, orange peel and honey coat the palate, the texture is lush, the acidity intense. A long, complex aftertaste completes the experience. Try now with food or wait until 1999. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: A dense and creamy Riesling, medium- to full-bodied and tightly meshed. Rich and smoky, with an exotic overtone of Indian spices and jasmine accenting the ripe green melon, grapefruit sorbet and nectarine flavors. Well-defined and lingering on the dry, zesty finish. Drink now through 2035. 480 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: A bright, lip-smacking white, underscored by zesty minerality, this meshes a powerful structure of acidity and minerality with accessible flavors of peach skin, tangerine peel, plum, wet stone and ground ginger. The long finish resonates with hints of crystallized honey, smoke and stone. Drink now through 2029. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Firm acidity structures this big, stony white, helping to balance riper fruit flavors of peach and tangerine with smoke, white pepper, brine and lemon zest. Compact and racy, gaining intensity on the zesty, spice-laden finish. Drink now through 2030. 700 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Rich and densely flavored with tropical fruit, smoke and mineral, this multifaceted white turns dry and focused on the finish, courtesy of its vibrant structure. It reveals class and a great expression of site, with a long, mineral-infused aftertaste. Best from 2005 through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: The apricot, orange and mango aromas explode from the glass, followed by spice and mineral flavors. It's almost dry, offset by vibrant acidity, all combined with a balance and harmony. Lingering aftertaste of licorice. Needs time to integrate all the elements. Drink now through 2010. 180 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand
review: A bold white that shows a sense of finesse, with a lovely interplay between the spicy minerality and racy acidity. Shows rich flavors of honeyed almond and candied orange zest, accented by bright hints of floral, green melon and pink grapefruit pulp. Exhibits power in a sleek, exciting package. Drink now through 2029. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand
review: This is a big Riesling, offering lots of minerally smoke on the nose and palate, with intensely vivacious, crackling acidity throughout. Flavors of white peach, papaya and star fruit are focused and pure, but ultimately play second fiddle right now to the block of mineral character. The finish is fresh and clean, with a long, spicy note of freshly ground white pepper. Drink now through 2034. 390 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand
review: Bold, full-bodied and ripe, with peach, quince and mineral aromas and flavors, this is concentrated and vivid, with the electric structure resonating on the palate. Dry and focused, it has a lingering finish of peach and mineral. Drink now through 2015. 395 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand
review: Fabulous. Full-bodied, dense and complex, this is one of the Rieslings of the vintage. Rich, with exotic, botrytis-tinged flavors of orange and honey accenting the mélange of tropical fruit, pear, gingerbread and mineral aromas and flavors on a firm, broad framework. A hint of sweetness balances the bright acidity, but this needs rich food to match its opulence. Delicious now, but will improve over time. Drink now through 2010. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand
review: Almost hypnotic for the spice, mineral and red berry perfumes that burst from the glass, this lovely white delivers exotic flavors of passion fruit and mineral on a framework that's lean and intense yet rich and full-bodied simultaneously, followed by an endless finish. Drinkable now, but it will only get better. Best from 2001 through 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand Vendange Tardive
review: A drier version of the late-harvest style, this vibrant wine is framed by tangy, integrated acidity that enlivens layers of ripe yellow peach, blood orange and grapefruit granita flavors, bringing out subtle accents of truffle, beeswax and fleur de sel. Drink now through 2027. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand Vendange Tardive
review: Broad and honeyed, yet with a firm structure. Shows a hint of bitterness, like grapefruit peel, pulling it out of balance for now. It's young, so give it time to develop. Long, smoky finish. Best from 2009 through 2020. 420 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand Vieilles Vignes
review: A lush and lightly mouthcoating white, balancing mango, pineapple, honey and guava flavors with finely focused, mouthwatering acidity. Features a base of minerally salinity, with tangerine, rose petal and spice accents that linger on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand Vieilles Vignes
review: Rich and just off-dry, this Riesling is very aromatic with apple blossom and lychee notes, as well as pure flavors of patisserie apple and pear, pineapple, crystallized honey and candied pink grapefruit peel. For all its richness, this is fine-textured and silky, with subtle, juicy acidity that drives the wine and keeps it lively, with a long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2034. 450 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: This shows lots of ripe yellow peach, papaya, tangerine and candied pink grapefruit peel, with a solid block of spicy minerality. Concentrated layers of flavor are brightened by the intense acidity, and all the pieces find fine balance. The result is a racehorse of a wine, where power meets grace of form. Drink now through 2030. 290 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg
review: Ripe and intense, yet with a sense of grace thanks to its vivid structure. White peach, passion fruit and pineapple flavors pick up a mineral accent. Lacy, balanced and long. Drink now through 2015. 510 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Wintzenheim Clos Häuserer
review: A powerful white, boasting a richly spicy minerality and a firm, angular cut of acidity. The well-structured frame bolsters the finely meshed layers of peach skin, fresh ginger, star fruit and tangerine peel that echo on the long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2030. 480 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Wintzenheim Clos Häuserer
review: This vibrant Riesling is just off-dry, focused by finely placed acidity that drives the flavors of macerated peach and apricot, candied pink grapefruit and lemon curd, with a base of stony minerality. Appealing now, but the precision balance suggests a long life ahead. Drink now through 2034. 670 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Wintzenheim Clos Häuserer
review: Lots of smoke and mineral lay the foundations for this powerhouse Riesling, with a full-bodied framework and laserlike acidity. A panoply of flavors fill it in, including red grapefruit, star fruit and quince, with a touch of honey and plenty of white pepper and citrus zest. The finish is long and lingering. Drink now through 2025. 833 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Wintzenheim Clos Häuserer
review: A big, powerful Riesling, with the stamp of place. Smoky, with dried pineapple aromas, honey and a fireworks of mineral. Concentrated, with a firm structure, this has a resonant energy that pumps it up on the long finish. Drink now through 2020. 375 cases made.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Wintzenheim Rotenberg Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Balanced and clean, this rich but zesty wine offers lime and honey flavors, both firm acidity and marked sweetness. It finishes on a pleasant, bitter almond note. Has character and should develop well in the bottle. Drink now through 2005.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Calcaire
review: A seamless white, light-weight and silky in texture, with mouthwatering acidity enlivening the subtly honeyed flavors of peach skin, orange sorbet and ground ginger, all underscored by rich, minerally notes of stone and smoke that echo on the finish. Drink now through 2029. 500 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert
review: Basil and star anise notes herald this rich, full-bodied white, with a creamy palate of glazed apricot, candied kumquat, pickled ginger and lychee layered with laserlike acidity that keeps this honeyed white in fine balance. Long, lasting finish of ground white pepper and citrus zest. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2030. 180 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert
review: Finely knit and silky, this mouthwatering white offers lush layers of guava, lychee, ground ginger and cardamom, with honey and grapefruit sorbet flavors. A subtle vein of smoky minerality pulses through the wine, gaining momentum on the finish. Drink now through 2029. 200 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert
review: Racy acidity drives this rich, creamy and honeyed white, offering a zesty core of ground spice and mineral layered with flavors of ripe melon, lychee, glazed apricot and orange sorbet. The mouthwatering finish delivers lasting notes of candied pink grapefruit zest and fresh ginger. Drink now through 2025. 45 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert
review: This smells like sweet baking apple pie on the nose, but is much drier and almost tangy on the palate. Hints of apple sauce and cinnamon give a nod to the aromas, along with flavors of lychee, grapefruit peel, white pepper and smoke. Firm acidity provides balance for the ripe flavors, and the finish lingers with a smoky caramel note. Drink now through 2025. 220 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert
review: Fascinating. It tastes like a fruit cocktail, yet there's nuance and length to its passion fruit, tangerine and mango accents and plenty of acidity driving the flavors. The sweetness is deftly balanced by not only bhe zippy structure but the density of flavors. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Gueberschwihr Goldert
review: So aromatic, the accents almost suggest mint and pine, then the flavors fan out to reveal honey, grapefruit and black currant set against a velvety texture and lively backbone. This goes beyond the grape, expressing its site beautifully. Drink now through 2004.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: This well-structured white is broad and creamy, offering ripe Jonagold apple and green melon flavors, juicy acidity and candied orange zest hints. Bright and finely knit. The finish echoes flint and honeycomb accents. Drink now through 2030. 160 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Huge nose of botrytized fruit. Apricots, oranges, almonds and honey are punctuated by an intensity that puts this in a league of its own. Full-bodied, like a red wine in white-wine clothing, it displays bright acidity and a long finish. Forget dessert, drink this instead.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain Vendange Tardive
review: Big and bold, with a deep caramel hue and acidity that cuts like a whip, making this VT seem more like a dry wine than a late-harvest. The layers of flavor include orange and grapefruit peel, dried apricot, raisin, clove and myrrh. Long finish. Drink now through 2036. 130 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst
review: A creamy, harmonious white, with firm acidity and a smoky underpinning wrapped in a juicy, honeyed mix of guava, melon ball, orange sorbet, candied ginger and pink grapefruit zest. Dense and well-knit. Drink now through 2030. 240 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst
review: This rich, juicy Gewürztraminer is defined by the firm acidity that gives it structure, along with the smoke and honeysuckle flavors that wind through the ripe lychee, clementine and mango notes. Bright and lively, with many layers to be discovered. Drink now through 2023. 1,100 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst
review: A textbook version, with a creamy palate that showcases flavors of lychee, orange zest, white pepper, rose petal and a touch of honey. This is dry, with zesty acidity driving through to the lingering, smoke-tinged finish. Very open-knit and delicious. Drink now through 2020. 175 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst
review: A big, powerful Gewürztraminer, concentrated with smoked meat, dried apricot, white pepper and mineral aromas and flavors. Quite dry, despite its ample flesh, with a long, salty finish. Needs food. Drink now through 2012. 290 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Wintzenheim Hengst
review: Although impressive, this seems a little compact today. Concentrated, with pure apricot, honey and grapefruit peel flavors, a touch of residual sweetness and vibrant structure. The finish is saturated and long; it just needs some time to unwind. Best from 2006 through 2015. 260 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Gueberschwihr
review: Though rich, this maintains energy and elegance thanks to its laserlike acidity, which rollercoasters through the wine, supporting flavors of blood orange and grapefruit sorbet, a touch of lychee and lots of white pepper. Dry and concentrated, with a lingering finish laced with candied orange peel and smoke. Drink now through 2025. 100 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: Beautifully balanced, with racy acidity driving the finely meshed palate of yellow peach, apple blossom, candied pink grapefruit, ground ginger and clover honey. Medium-bodied and minerally, with smoke and orange blossom notes lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 260 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: There's a tension to this floral Gewürz, with tightly knit flavors of candied grapefruit zest, blood orange, honey, ripe peach, smoke and fleur de sel wrapped by firm, intense acidity. Lacy in texture, this finds lovely balance. Mouthwatering, spiced finish. Drink now through 2027.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: Ripe, opulent and soft in structure, this has a seductive combination of vanilla, honey, tropical fruit and spice, with a hint of bitterness on the finish. There's also a freshness that makes it so appealing now. Very harmonious and long. Drink now through 2008. 185 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: A classically proportioned Gewürztraminer, amped up to high wattage. Concentrated flavors of litchi, floral and spice with feral accents and a pleasant bitterness emerging on the long finish. Distinctive. Drink now through 2005. 200 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive
review: Packed with caramel, honey and spice aromas and flavors, the sweetness dominates today, yet there's a good structure supporting it all and the finish is very, very long. A little obvious perhaps, but impressive. Best from 2005 through 2015. 50 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim
review: Really exciting. Super smoky and packed with mineral elements, this white has richness and body, yet seems almost racy, with vibrant acidity and a touch of grapefruit bitterness providing cut. Green tea on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 125 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg
review: Light, with a fine, silky texture, packed with layers of ripe apricot, blood orange, candied pink grapefruit zest, pickled ginger and ground anise. Vibrant acidity imparts focus through the lasting, mineral-driven finish. Drink now through 2025. 45 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg
review: This white shows fine texture and richness of flavor, with layered notes of apricot, mango, pink grapefruit zest, crystallized honey, smoky mineral and ground ginger, pepper and cardamom, yet the wine stays bright and lively, structured like fine china by deft acidity. Drink now through 2027.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Heimbourg Vendange Tardive
review: Thick and rich, yet still vibrant and intense, this multi-layered wine marries racy grapefruit acidity with honeyed sweetness in  a spicy, harmonious package with a lingering finish. Has the balance to match with food and the concentration to age.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Herrenweg
review: This juicy white delivers honeyed flavors of kumquat, star fruit, candied grapefruit, with exotic spice and smoke. The firm acidity finds precision balance with the silky, mouthcoating texture, and a pretty orange blossom note lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 975 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Herrenweg
review: Exotic, this is full of dried tropical fruit and citrus, with an undercurrent of mineral. Full-bodied and dense, yet stays light on its feet courtesy of the vibrant structure, a hallmark of the vintage. Lingering passion fruit aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 1,310 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Herrenweg Sélection de Grains Nobles Vieilles Vignes
review: Layers of ripe, honeyed fruit—papaya, mango, pineapple and yellow peach—abound, along with hints of tea rose, anise and candied orange peel. This is an open, creamy wine, with a firm backbone of acidity and a lingering, juicy finish. Drink now through 2025. 70 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Herrenweg Vieilles Vignes
review: Just off-dry and silky, this elegant white shows a honeyed edge to its flavors of dried apricot and papaya, candied grapefruit peel, smoky mineral, lychee and marmalade. A pretty note of fresh spring blossom winds through the wine, as does the finely meshed, vibrant acidity. The long, mouthwatering finish has a mineral accent. Drink now through 2024. 270 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Herrenweg Vieilles Vignes
review: This rich white displays honeyed fruit flavors of lychee, red grapefruit peel and mango, but all well-checked and balanced by an assertive gunpowder note and broad, integrated acidity. Hints of brine, white pepper and candle wax add interest, lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 250 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Vendange Tardive Vieilles Vignes
review: Mouthwatering and lacy in texture, this offers a zesty base note of minerality, with well-meshed flavors of lychee, green melon, pink grapefruit and spun honey, joined by accents of jasmine and ground pink peppercorn and ginger. Drink now through 2022.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Wintzenheim
review: A honeyed Gewuurztraminer, with hints of smoke and saline accenting the ripe yellow peach, papaya and tangerine notes. There's fine balance among the ripe fruit, the minerality and the lively acidity, and this finishes with a lingering touch of beeswax. Drink now through 2025.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Wintzenheim
review: Fresh, showing delicate floral, lychee and spice notes, despite its weight. Dry and powerful on the finish, but well-balanced overall, with a detailed aftertaste of grilled nuts and brioche. Drink now through 2012. 1,110 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Calcaire
review: Beautifully aromatic and enticing on the nose, with rich mineral, floral and ripe fruit character. This harmonious white is framed by racy acidity that creates a mouthwatering interplay with the silky palate of yellow peach, ground white pepper, ginger, passion fruit and candied kumquat flavors. Offers a long, lasting finish. Drink now through 2033. 170 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Calcaire
review: There's lots of mineral notes in this off-dry Pinot Gris, with creamy flavors of patisserie pear, almond paste, dried apricot and candied orange peel. It's all finely layered together, with zesty acidity balancing the lightly honeyed flavors and keeping the intensity through to the very long finish. Drink now through 2029. 370 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Calcaire
review: There's a hint of lychee to this white, with more typical flavors of yellow peach, honey and candied citrus peel. A strong vein of exotic spice runs through the wine, as does a laserlike acidity. This is a mouthful, with more layers and nuances at each turn. Should age beautifully. Drink now through 2025. 458 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Clos Jebsal Vendange Tardive
review: A lovely, vibrant vendange tardive, just off-dry and driven by racy acidity and a zesty underpinning, deftly meshed with flavors of white peach, candied ginger, honeysuckle and citrus peel. Offers a fine, harmonious finish. Drink now through 2030. 415 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: A monolithic white, with a rich, smoky mineral character underscoring the firmly cut palate of glazed nectarine, dried papaya, crystallized honey and almond flavors. Well-spiced and intense, with a lovely, lasting and aromatic finish. Drink now through 2035. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: A vibrant white, lightly sweet and silky, offering lots of zesty acidity to balance the expressive pineapple, candied coconut and ginger, white peach puree and grapefruit zest notes. A spicy vein of minerality runs throughout and emerges on the finish. Drink now through 2027. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: Minerally and aromatic, offering lightly honeyed flavors of apricot, guava, crystallized pineapple and smoke, with hints of white pepper and cardamom. Luscious yet well-cut, with juicy, mouthwatering acidity and a lingering finish. Drink now through 2025.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: This delicious white is big, lush and warm, with apricot, grapefruit and spice flavors that are easy to cozy up to as it glides to a long, smoky finish. There's plenty of power in reserve, with a dry sensation on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 541 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain
review: There's plenty of residual sugar here, yet it's balanced by a vibrant structure, which also frames the pineapple, honey and mineral flavors nicely. Fine length, with an orange peel accent. This still needs time. Best from 2005 through 2012. 525 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Deeply colored, with mushroom and earth notes accenting the dried apricot and quince paste flavors. There's a bracing acidity supporting the sweetness, but it's a little on the coarse side today, needing more time to integrate. Best from 2005 through 2018. 90 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen de Thann Clos St.-Urbain Vendange Tardive
review: Like a gymnast, this lithe white glides across the palate, its underlying strength and tautness merely supporting the dried apricot, guava, honey and candied citrus. Finish just melts away. Delicious. Drink now through 2004.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: Rich and flinty on the nose, this sleek, medium-bodied Pinot Gris offers racy acidity structuring the lightly honeyed flavors of glazed apricot, candied blood orange zest, crushed almond and smoke. Long and spicy on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: An elegant version, with racy acidity and a lacy texture carrying the finely woven mix of yellow peach, spring blossom, orange zest and Brazil nut. Long and minerally on the mouthwatering, spiced finish. Drink now through 2027. 770 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: A honeyed, off-dry Pinot Gris, with pretty honeysuckle and apple blossom notes mixing with the peach compote, orange sorbet, candied grapefruit zest and sweet smoke flavors. Lush and mouthcoating, but still light-weight and silky, thanks to well-cut acidity that finds seamless integration. The long finish layers lots of spice and mineral. Drink now through 2029. 290 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl
review: Massive, rich and thick, this white has a deep golden color and a sweet, tropical fruit character. Long fermentation (12 months) has enhanced exotic vanilla and butterscotch components that are absolutely stunning, from the honey and botrytis flavors to the exhausting finish. Like a chess grand master rather than an overpowering brute.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Hunawihr Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive
review: Focused, firm and very elegant, packing peach, apricot and pineapple aromas and flavors into a lithe frame. Lovely lingering aftertaste of peach jam. Drink now through 2015. 235 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal
review: Laserlike acidity is well-meshed in the honeyed folds of this lush wine, creating an overall elegant expression and knit, and driving the exuberant range of pureed mango, candied nectarine, grapefruit granita, ground ginger and pink peppercorn. The mouthwatering finish shows lasting, zesty character. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2035. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal
review: An intense walnut oil aroma introduces this opulent, mouthcoating Pinot Gris. Bold and packed with caramel, hazelnut and crème brûlée flavors, it impresses with its intensity, yet needs time to integrate and find its balance. Off-dry, it will pair well with foie gras and stuffed pork roast. Best from 2004 through 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Turckheim Clos Jebsal Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Unctuous. Thick and rich, carrying an amazing array of violet, apricot, citrus peel and caramel flavors on a surprisingly deft structure. Fine length, with caramel aftertaste. Drink now through 2006.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino Benchland
review: Raspberry and dried currant flavors have very good intensity, with cedar, vanilla and tangy structure on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 4,700 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino Reserve
review: Menthol notes add a refreshing edge to the ripe berry and cherry flavors. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino
review: Light, with tart cherry and herbal notes that turn drying on the finish. Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino
review: Earthy plum and dried berry notes finish a bit hot. Drink now. 8,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Ballard Canyon Kimsey Vineyard Reserve
review: Rich and focused, with a vibrant core of acidity and mineral-tinged tannins. Offers complex flavors of blueberry and currant, accented by hints of lead pencil, white pepper and smoky herb. Hands off for now. Best from 2018 through 2027. 142 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Plush and jammy, with moderate complexity and rich yet easygoing flavors of raspberry, cracked pepper and smoky anise. Drink now through 2024. 100 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Thompson Vineyard
review: Jammy and plump, with bold huckleberry and licorice aromas and racy flavors of dark plum, smoky bacon and cracked pepper. The finish lingers. Drink now through 2023. 146 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Barbara County White Hawk Vineyard
review: Toast, spice and tobacco notes are smoky and intense up front, with a core of lemon meringue and dried apricot flavors that are rich and expressive on the long finish. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Blanca Santa Barbara County
review: Rich, with toast and vanilla overtones to the ripe peach and marmalade flavors at the core. Spicy on the finish, where a note of almond skin lingers. Roussanne, Marsanne and Grenache Blanc. Drink now. 245 cases made.

name: Rosé Santa Barbara County
review: Pretty strawberry and orange zest scents lead to zesty, vibrant flavors of spicy watermelon. Grenache and Grenache Blanc. Drink now. 410 cases made.

name: Syrah Ballard Canyon Kimsey Vineyard, Blk 1 Reserve
review: Taut but a bit racy, with lively notes of dried cherry, licorice and pencil lead that linger toward grippy tannins. Best after 2027. 141 cases made.

name: Grenache Central Coast
review: Spicy cinnamon and raspberry aromas meet super-jammy, ripe flavors. Drink now through 2018. 197 cases made.

name: Roussanne Ballard Canyon Kimsey Vineyard
review: A mineral edge gives a saline tinge to toast, marmalade and lemon zest notes, on a medium body with a firm acidity. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Grenache Central Coast
review: Offers aromas of smoky plum and modest flavors of dried cherry, herb and pepper. Drink now through 2026. 97 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California
review: Juicy and easy to sip, with lively dried cherry and spicy vanilla flavors. Drink now through 2012. 4,877 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California
review: Juicy but simple, with notes of cherry and spicy herbs. Drink now. 1,467 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vines
review: Simple, with modest cherry and herb flavors. Drink now. 12,536 cases made.

name: Armon Galilee
review: Plush and supple, with concentrated and refined flavors of raspberry, plum tart and dark cherry. The finish is suffused with sandalwood. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petite Sirah. Kosher. Drink now. 627 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Galilee Tidhar
review: Fresh and focused, with a seductive mineral and spice edge to the red plum, boysenberry and raspberry flavors. Mocha and chocolate notes linger on the juicy finish. Kosher. Drink now. 450 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Galilee Tidhar
review: Medium-bodied, offering plenty of smoky overtones to the red fruit flavors. Finishes with chipotle pepper notes. Kosher. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Petit Syrah-Merlot Galilee Erez
review: Has an odd mix of meaty and dried fruit flavors. Kosher. 600 cases imported.

name: Noto Doppiozeta
review: Creamy tannins enfold the focused flavors of crushed raspberry and dried fig in this harmonious, medium- to full-bodied red, with an underlying note of smoky mineral. Aromatic accents of licorice snap, violet and herb show on the chewy finish. Nero d'Avola with Syrah. Drink now through 2027. 1,042 cases made.

name: Noto Doppiozeta
review: Stylish, with suave, finely knit tannins and a mouthwatering thread of juicy acidity that laces the flavors of pure black cherry puree, mocha, melted licorice, herbed olive and star anise. Harmonious and accessible now, but should develop with short-term cellaring. Nero d'Avola and Syrah. Drink now through 2025. 1,167 cases made.

name: Noto Doppiozeta
review: Tarry smoke and tobacco notes underscore the boysenberry coulis, mocha and ground anise flavors in this dark, rich red. Well-balanced and juicy throughout, with fine-grained tannins that build on the lasting finish. Nero d'Avola, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2024. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sicilia Effe Emme
review: Aromas of graphite and spice accent the rich black cherry pâte de fruit and crème de cassis flavors, finely knit with supple tannins and notes of fig bread, smoke, bay leaf and loamy earth. Medium- to full-bodied and fresh, with an aromatic finish. Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2027. 417 cases made.

name: Noto Doppiozeta
review: A subtle hint of tar underscores flavors of sappy black cherry and spiced plum fruit, adding complexity to this medium- to full-bodied red. Chewy and balanced, with lightly juicy acidity and hints of cured tobacco and spice box lingering on the finish. Nero d'Avola, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2023. 1,083 cases made.

name: Noto Doppiozeta
review: Supple and well-knit, this medium-bodied red features a note of loamy earth underscoring the flavors of ripe black cherry and licorice drop, with hints of bresaola and mocha. Additional sweet fruit nuances linger on the fresh finish. Nero d'Avola, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2022. 583 cases made.

name: Sicilia
review: A lovely, medium-bodied red, with a pure beam of ripe cherry and fresh acidity layered with supple tannins and accents of star anise, dried thyme, loamy earth and mocha. Drink now through 2023. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sicilia
review: Blackberry, fresh herbs and earth, with a hint of oak on the nose. Medium-bodied, with a tight bead of black fruit and mineral driving through the finish, held together by light but firm tannins. Well-defined and delicious. The first wine from this new estate. From the Mazzei family of Tuscany. Nero d'Avola. Drink now through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sicilia Doppiozeta
review: A ripe, balanced red, with notes of game and mesquite accenting the ripe blackberry and plum fruit. Silky tannins add weight and definition, as hints of grilled herb and iron linger on the finish. Nero d'Avola, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2015. 1,670 cases made.

name: Terre Siciliane Effe Emme
review: Hints of spice and baking chocolate accent pureed black cherry and crème de cassis fruit flavors in this bright, brambly, medium-bodied red. Features grippy tannins, with abundant star anise, orange bergamot, coffee and smoke notes on the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2023. 333 cases made.

name: Noto
review: This bright, elegant red is medium-bodied, with well-knit flavors of wild cherry, dried thyme and tangy mineral. Offers a hint of mocha and chewy tannins on the fresh finish. Nero d'Avola. Drink now through 2022. 9,583 cases made.

name: Noto
review: This bright red is creamy and well-balanced, with a spicy, mineral-tinged undertow and expressive flavors of brambly berry, wild herb and licorice. Light, fine tannins and a hint of tar show on the finish. Drink now through 2021. 8,333 cases made.

name: Sicilia
review: A fresh red, with a rich core of black cherry coulis and boysenberry fruit, featuring accents of licorice string, dried marjoram, tar and tobacco leaf. Harmonious, delivering a long finish. Drink now through 2019. 8,300 cases made.

name: Sicilia Doppiozeta
review: Very Mediterranean on the nose, with notes of plum jam, rosemary, capers and sun-baked minerals. Medium- to full-bodied, with a tasty, racy palate and a peppery fruit finish. Lacks a little depth and length, but a super drink. Nero d'Avola, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Sicilia White Azisa
review: A sleek, medium-bodied white, featuring lively acidity and well-knit flavors of Honeycrisp apple, spring blossom, pickled ginger and melon. The delicate finish is lightly juicy, with a lingering presence of stony mineral. Grillo and Catarratto. Drink now through 2020. 2,917 cases made.

name: Terre Siciliane Effe Emme
review: Hints of violet and graphite accent flavors of crushed mulberry and plum in this well-meshed, medium-bodied red. A firm frame of chewy tannins holds sway on the mineral- and herb-laced finish. Petit Verdot. Best from 2019 through 2024. 750 cases made.

name: Sicilia
review: Ripe damson plum, forest fruit, orange peel and floral aromas. Medium-bodied, with a hint of orange and dark chocolate character coming through. Finishes tight and fresh. This has more delicate structure than the 2006, but offers very good freshness and drinkability. Nero d'Avola. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Sicilia
review: This interesting red offers black cherry, flowers and ferrous minerals on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with lots of iris and black fruit, fine tannins and a medium finish. Needs some bottle age to mellow. Nero d'Avola. Best after 2008. 8,300 cases made.

name: Sicilia White Azisa
review: A sleek, light- to medium-bodied white, with lip-smacking acidity and a streak of smoky mineral, layered with Asian pear, grapefruit zest, spring blossom and apricot notes. Grillo and Catarratto. Drink now through 2019. 2,667 cases made.

name: Sicilia
review: A moderate version, with firm tannins and a silky palate of dried cherry, cranberry fruit, tea leaf, rose petal and loamy earth notes. Nero d'Avola. Drink now through 2017. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sicilia
review: A gamy yet supple, red, with fresh acidity backing the roasted plum and dried cherry notes that weave through hints of tobacco and dried herb. Nero d'Avola. Drink now. 8,333 cases made.

name: Sicilia
review: Ripe and gamy, offering aromas of bresaola that lead to plum and blackberry pudding notes, as licorice and smoke add a touch of complexity on the finish. Nero d'Avola. Drink now. 8,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Roller Coaster
review: Medium-bodied, offering ripe flavors of cola, black cherry and blackberry that show good intensity, with pepper, floral and a slight savory edge. The intensity and tannins pick up on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 280 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Russian River Valley
review: Soft and easygoing, with perfumed tropical fruit aromas and spicy, toasty pear flavors. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Edna Valley Paragon Vineyard
review: Crisp and clean, with flavors of lemon, lime and grapefruit, accented by hints of lemon verbena on the lip-smacking finish. Drink now. 3,365 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Edna Valley Paragon Vineyard
review: Light and refreshing. The crisp edge of lemon and grapefruit flavors shows a peppery, spicy accent, with zingy acidity. Drink now. 2,649 cases made.

name: Riesling Edna Valley Paragon Vineyard
review: There's a honeyed note to the rose-scented melon, peach and citrus flavors of this juicy and aromatic white, with appealing acidity and a lingering finish. Drink now. 359 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Edna Valley Paragon Vineyard
review: Crisp and mouthwatering, with a firm, bright acidity highlighting the green apple and lemon flavors. A touch of minerality shows on the finish. Drink now. 2,717 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Edna Valley Paragon Vineyard
review: A bracing acidity gives way to fresh, zingy lemon, grapefruit and green apple flavors, with a hint of pepper and spice on the finish. Drink now. 926 cases made.

name: Riesling Edna Valley Paragon Vineyard
review: Crisp, clean and refreshing, with a vivid juicy core of lemon, green apple and lime flavors balanced by an appealing whiff of mineral and petrol. Drink now. 802 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Edna Valley Paragon Vineyard
review: Vibrantly, mouthwateringly juicy, with a core of lemony citrus notes, finishing a tad coarse. Drink now. 3,575 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Pisces
review: Coarse and chunky, but the toasty oak and pear flavors are solid on the finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Gemini
review: Tart, lean and simple, lacking ripe or varietal fruit flavors. Passable as a white table wine though. 300 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Merveille
review: Lovely aromas of toasted coconut, vanilla and whole-grain bread mark this intense, delineated Champagne. Despite its vibrant structure, there's a creaminess, and it picks up honey, apple and grilled hazelnut notes. Terrific complexity and personality. Drink now through 2012. 600 cases imported.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Précieuse
review: Textbook blanc de blancs. Aromas and flavors of toast, pencil shavings, hazelnut and honey with hints of candied fruit ride a vibrant structure. It's balanced and well-integrated, with energy and a long, refreshing finish. Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Désirable
review: Firm and spicy, with graphite, ginger and cinnamon notes swirling around the fine mousse. Finishes fresh and long, with a honey aftertaste. Drink now through 2015. 150 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Merveille
review: On the neutral side, offering modest berry, grapefruit and chalk notes. It's balanced, but the volume is turned down to a whisper. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella
review: A firm, focused red, well-knit and juicy, with bright red currant and cherry fruit, accented by fresh flavors of loamy earth, grilled herb, mocha and graphite. The refined finish echoes the fruit and herb notes. Drink now through 2025. 15,800 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella
review: Elegant and creamy, this well-knit red is lightly juicy and aromatic, with incense, floral and herb notes accenting the dried currant, fig cake and smoke notes. Drink now through 2021. 7,900 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella
review: Aromatic accents of dried thyme, sage and ground anise lace the cherry and pomegranate fruit, with tea leaf and smoky mineral notes adding balance. Light tannins grace the clean finish. Drink now through 2019. 900 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Il Maso
review: Great buy for Amarone. Beautifully fruity and focused, a pure note of cherry-berry flavor harmonizing with subtle spicy, cedary accents. Smooth texture and rare sense of elegance. 2,000 cases made.

name: Asti
review: Great example of a semisweet Italian bubbly. Bright, lively, refreshing and overflowing with citrus and almond flavors. 50,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella
review: Fresh and fruity Amarone, with forest fruits, minerals and a light oak note. Full-bodied, with sweet fruit, fine tannins and an intense finish. Good effort here. Best after 2007. 2,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella
review: Clean aromas of currant and mineral follow through to a full-bodied, silky palate with fresh fruit and mineral on the finish. Nicely done. Best after 2005. 2,500 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella
review: Clean and tightly packed berry, mineral and dark chocolate aromas follow through to a full-bodied palate, with firm tannins and a long, fruity, minerally finish. Zonin is working hard on its Amarone. Best after 2005. 2,500 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs
review: Light and crisp, with delicate peach and vanilla notes that develop more oomph on the finish. Starts off like it's going to be light and fresh, and picks up steam as the flavors develop. Very nicely made, even though it's not methode champenoise. 5,000 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso
review: Ripe raspberry, violet, dried herb and fig cake notes feature prominently in this bright, aromatic red. Well-knit, with a subtle minerally underpinning and light tannins that show on the spiced finish. Drink now through 2019. 38,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella
review: Prune, licorice, tobacco and a touch of mint are the aromas and flavors in this Amarone with personality. There's a nice glycerinlike feel midpalate, slightly dry tannins on the finish. Good effort in a difficult vintage. Drink now through 2005. 2,200 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Il Maso
review: Suave and smooth, showing spicy, oaky accents to the seemingly sweet raspberry and cherry flavors. Coffee and chocolate notes add complexity. Nicely balanced for drinking now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Delle Venezie Berengario
review: Soft, easygoing red, with berry, fresh herb and cherry liqueur character. Full-bodied, with soft tannins and a fruity finish. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso
review: Pleasant plum and cherry on the nose, following through to a medium-bodied palate, with fine tannins and a fresh, fruity finish. A clean red. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Venezia-Giulia Red Berengario
review: A relaxed red, with spicy berry and light chocolate character. Medium-bodied, with a fresh, fruity palate, integrated tannins and a fresh finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Grand Soleil Stellenbosch
review: Oak-aging adds complexity to this balanced, concentrated wine. Though the apple and melon flavors are muted, the oak is integrated rather than imposed. Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Juicy, with pear and fig fruit followed by judicious toast. Drink now. 24,700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: An elegant version, this Chardonnay exudes pineapple and even orange aromas and flavors, remaining bright and focused through the lingering finish. Could use a tad more concentration. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Nice citrus aroma and flavor here, with hints of chamomile and honey. A touch blowsy on the finish, but hanging in there. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Simple and flavorful, with good plum, currant and spice flavors. Smooth and uncomplicated, with a touch of chocolate on the finish. Try with pasta. Drink now.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Vintner's Selection
review: The spicy, smoky aromas show kinship with Pinot Noir, but it's sweet and simple on the palate. The berry flavors are pretty, but lack definition. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Spicy, round and generous, with flavors that run more toward fig and caramel than to citrus. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Has some straightforward apple flavor, but comes off a bit dilute and short in the end. Almost concocted in feel. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: Lean, with modest cherry and herb notes, turning a touch tart in the end. 23,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Muddled and lacking direction, with modest stewed plum flavor. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: A tart, tightly wound Chardonnay, with generic white wine flavors and a crisp finish. Simple and direct in taste.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
review: Simple stewed plum flavors lack focus, and it finishes short. 6,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Raisiny and slightly overripe; rubbery character. Drink if you must.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
review: Lean and green tasting, with hefty tannins and a dry finish. There is a bit of charm in the spicy, cherrylike aroma, but it fades quickly.

name: Grand Soleil Vintner's Selection Stellenbosch
review: An earthy-smelling white that's very dry, almost austere in flavor, and then turns metallic on the finish. Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Chenin Blanc.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: This is past its prime. Tired and rustic, with cola and tea flavors. Earthy and leathery; a cloying finish.

name: Cabernet Breganze Vigneto Due Santi
review: Displays pleasant currant fruit, tinged with lilac and mineral, on a medium palate, with a tight, well-structured texture and a clean finish of fruit and mineral. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Merlot Breganze
review: Light and fruity, with black currant and a hint of fresh herbs. A bit candied and rustic. Drink now. 1,830 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Baron Von Nemesis
review: Smooth and round, wrapped in a layer of fine tannins. The exotic flavors of cherry, guava, goji berry and tropical spices billow easily on the long finish. Best from 2014 through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Langhorne Creek Avalon Tree
review: Broad, supple, ripe and expressive, with a dense texture, this red is deep in flavor, roiling with black currant, mint and licorice flavors. Finishes with intensity. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Z-Force McLaren Vale
review: Polished, round and distinctive for its herbal and mineral overtones around a focused core of currant and plum fruit. Lingers with intensity. Shiraz and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2019. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Baron Von Nemesis
review: Supple, silky and appealing, offering a beautifully modulated mouthful of cherry, plum, black olive and tobacco flavors that glide sinuously through the finish. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Malbec Langhorne Creek Violet Beauregard Single Site
review: Broad, bright and open-textured, with plush currant and blueberry fruit, shaded with hints of mint and spice. Lingers well. Drink now through 2019. 1,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Langhorne Creek
review: Broad and generous. A real mouthful of smoky, tar-scented blackberry and licorice flavors, persisting against fine tannins on the long finish. Best from 2009 through 2015. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek Lake Doctor Vineyard
review: Dark and spicy, with a strong licorice note weaving through the dark berry and wet gravel flavors, persisting on the generous finish. Best from 2012 through 2019. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Malbec Clare Valley Violet Beauregard Single Site
review: Dark, fleshy and surprisingly deft, this offers ripe plum and blackberry flavors riding on a sleek frame. Drink now through 2016. 2,200 cases made.

name: Malbec Langhorne Creek Violet Beauregard
review: Ripe, soft and generous with its spicy, licorice-accented plum and dried currant flavors, lingering against refined tannins on the smoky finish. Drink now through 2015. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek Lake Doctor
review: Ripe, supple and appealing for its rich cherry and spice flavors, this red brings in a licorice note on the finish. Has density without much weight. Drink now through 2017. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek Lake Doctor Single Site
review: Vibrant and appealing, with a mouthful of wild blueberry and blackberry flavors, peppery accents and a chewy, espresso-laced finish. Drink now through 2028. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Fleurieu Peninsula Avalon Tree Single Site
review: Ripe and rich, with a soft edge to the licorice-accented black cherry and floral flavors, lingering on the polished finish. Drink now through 2017. 3,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Fleurieu Peninsula Avalon Tree
review: Juicy and plush, offering a peppery, spicy take on cherry and plum flavors, with black tea and licorice accents and terrific focus on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 2,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Malbec Langhorne Creek
review: Lithe and supple, with a lively core of raspberry and cherry flavors shaded with floral and cedary notes on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Langhorne Creek
review: Smooth in texture and medium-bodied, showing bright blackberry and boysenberry fruit that's shaded with hints of apricot and floral notes on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Langhorne Creek
review: Lithe, supple and appealing for its vibrant plum and blackberry fruit, shaded with hints of white pepper and cream. Drink now through 2008. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Fleurieu Peninsula Avalon Tree Single Site
review: Taut, focused and generous, with dark berry, tomato leaf and tarry spice flavors, melding smoothly on the extended finish. Best from 2015 through 2019. 4,200 cases made.

name: Savignin Blanc Langhorne Creek The Love Symbol
review: Light, bright and jazzy, as a mineral edge adds interest to the lemon and Golden Delicious apple flavors. Finishes with some intensity. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Baron Von Nemesis
review: Toast and vanilla flavors work gracefully with the plump cherry and plum notes, finishing with a big dash of clove-scented spices. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek Lake Doctor Vineyard Single Site
review: Firm and ripe, with crunchy tannins around a juicy core of blackberry and cherry fruit, picking up stony notes as the finish lingers. Best after 2016. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Malbec Langhorne Creek
review: Soft and ripe, with generous black cherry and currant flavors, hinting at a savory note as the finish persists gamely. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Scarlet Ladybird Rosé Fleurieu Peninsula
review: A pretty wine, this dry rosé offers delicate pear, raspberry and rose petal flavors that linger with simplicity. Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Langhorne Creek
review: Bright and distinctive for the spicy, refreshing edge it gets from Viognier (maybe a tad too much), this has lively blackberry, tar and pickle barrel flavors that linger nicely. Drink now through 2008. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Langhorne Creek Single Site
review: Smooth and easy, with dark berry and spice flavors, lingering with polish. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Langhorne Creek Avalon Tree
review: Ripe and supple on a medium-weight frame, offering cherry and plum fruit shaded with smoke and dill notes. The finish lingers nicely. Drink now through 2016. 200 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Langhorne Creek Avalon Tree
review: Firm in texture, with refined tannins around a refreshing core of currant and cream flavors, lingering easily. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Savignin Blanc Langhorne Creek The Love Symbol
review: Light and refined, with pretty pear and lime blossom flavors on a refined frame. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Verdelho Fleurieu Peninsula Sea Makeover Single Site
review: Fruity, tangy and generous, with pear and resin flavors. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Malbec Langhorne Creek
review: Soft and ripe. Light on its feet, with ripe currant and raspberry flavors that linger against hints of earth and spice. Drink now through 2012. 400 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Langhorne Creek
review: Smells great, with just the right spicy, floral edge to the ultraripe berry and dried cherry flavors, but there's a bitter edge to the finish that makes it less appealing. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Savagnin Fleurieu Peninsula The Love Symbol Single Site
review: Light and citrusy, with a coconut edge to the lime and spice flavors. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Verdelho Langhorne Creek Sea Makeover Single Site
review: Fresh and a bit green, with hints of freshly mowed grass around the citrus core. Drink now. 420 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley 34 Year Old Vines
review: Lively and intense, with generous toasty oak, pine nut, chocolate, black currant, dried berry and black cherry. The oak, rich tannins and generous fruit flavors linger on the well-integrated finish. Drink now through 2005. 216 cases made.

name: Zinfandel San Francisco Bay 105 Year Old Vines
review: Quite concentrated, with plenty of pop to flavors of cedar, cherry, plum and dried berries. Intensity lingers through the ripe, firmly tannic finish. Drink now through 2006. 357 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles 30 Year Old Vines
review: Concentrated, with intense blackberry, chocolate and tobacco notes that show excellent length and richness. Drink now through 2004. 148 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Contra Costa County 102 Year Old Vines
review: Captures more ripeness, richness and depth than most '96s, showing plum, cherry, wild berry and spicy raspberry flavors and round, supple tannins. Third release from John Eppler of Rosenblum. Drink now through 2002. 289 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles 31 Year Old Vines
review: Ripe, rich and concentrated, with dried berry, earth and complex raspberry flavors, finishing with firm tannins and fine length. Drink now through 2004. 192 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Redwood Valley Ricetti Vineyard 33 Year Old Vines
review: A ripe, jammy style that avoids excess. Lots of pretty plum, black cherry and blackberry fruit that is rich and polished, offering depth and complexity. Drink now through 2005. 584 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley 33 Year Old Vines
review: Intense aromas of blueberry extract. Shows good depth and a zippy mouthfeel, with raisiny flavors and firm tannins. Drink now through 2001. 98 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles 29 Year Old Vines
review: Ripe and rich, with plum, spice, herb and black cherry flavors framed by toasted oak. Finishes with ripe tannins and slightly green notes. Drink now through 2002. 283 cases made.

name: Zinfandel San Francisco Bay 106 Year Old Vines
review: Port-like in its stewed plum ripeness, with spice, pepper, sweet black cherry extract and plum liqueur flavors. Cedar and solid tannins turn a bit earthy on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 366 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Contra Costa County 104 Year Old Vines
review: A bit offbeat yet authentic, it mixes sweet-tasting cherry and plum flavors with a juniper berry edge. Turns tannic. Drink now. 377 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley d'Ambrosio Vineyard 51 Year Old Vines
review: Superripe and syrupy, with potent alcohol aromas, followed by jammy plum and raspberry fruit. A late-picked style that's well-done but riper than most table wines. Drink now. 539 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles 32 Year Old Vines
review: Zesty, with bright, ripe raspberry and vanilla aromas in an easygoing style. Drink now. 322 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Redwood Valley Ricetti Vineyard 34 Year Old Vines
review: Ultraripe, in a late-picked, sugary style, with jammy, sypruy, sweet-tasting cherry and blackberry fruit. Well-made in this rather extremely ripe style. Drink now through 2008. 498 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley 86 Year Old Vines
review: Chewy, with very good concentration to syrupy dried berry, roasted plum and cola flavors. More like Port than table wine, with chocolate notes and sweetness. Drink now through 2008. 288 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley 42 Year Old Vines
review: Clean, with pleasant, up-front berry and cranberry flavors that are simple. Drink now. 308 cases made.

name: Petit Verdot Banghoek
review: Shows good medium-weight, juicy blackberry and cassis bush notes, with well-integrated toast. There's lively acidity, but the texture stays plush through the finish. Very tasty. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 325 cases made.

name: Richelle Stellenbosch
review: Slightly rugged in style, with currant paste, coffee and bittersweet cocoa notes laid over briar and loam on the chewy, broad finish. Shows lots of toast. For fans of the style. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2010. 250 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Banghoek
review: Light-bodied, with flint and lime notes followed by a twinge of green apple. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sta. Rita Hills Zoto
review: A steely white, with hints of dried green herbs to the fresh-cut apple, pear and green peach flavors. The minerally finish is pure and refreshing. Drink now through 2021. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
review: Rich and well-crafted, offering concentrated red fruit, dried berry and earth flavors that are filled with plenty of minerality. White pepper details show on the finish, with spice and mocha hints. Drink now through 2020. 425 cases made.

name: Syrah Sta. Rita Hills
review: Expressive boysenberry and smoky meat aromas lead to vibrant, well-built black cherry and black pepper flavors that linger on the long finish. Drink now through 2023. 375 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sta. Rita Hills
review: Steely and well-structured, with plenty of acidity behind the green apple, citrus and green pear flavors. Crisp and savory on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
review: A rustic yet pleasing style. Dry and savory, with dried berry, black tea and spice notes, offset by gripping, grainy tannins. Drink now through 2020. 528 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Zoto
review: Fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity support juicy red fruit flavors in this open-textured red. The minerally finish is well-spiced, with savory accents. Drink now through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Viognier Sta. Rita Hills
review: Starts with a bright, lemony focus, offering touches of green apple, pear and grapefruit zest, with crisp acidity from beginning to end. Refreshing. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Syrah Sta. Rita Hills
review: A modest effort, with notes of smoky plum, mineral and spice. Drink now through 2019. 216 cases made.

name: Viognier Sta. Rita Hills
review: Bright and lemony up front, with crisp acidity and accents of nuts, spice and vanilla. Finishes with a hint of lemon pith. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Collio
review: Lush, grassy character on the nose is accompanied by notes of fresh peach, apricot and almond paste. Medium- to full-bodied, with good fruit and mineral intensity. Compact and well-balanced, with a long, fruity finish. Superstylish. Equal parts Friulano, Chardonnay, Pinot Grigio and Sauvignon. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Collio
review: This is gorgeous, with honey, lime, pineapple and mango on the nose. Full and delicious, with loads of exotic fruit and a long finish. Wild fruit. Equal parts Tocai Friulano, Chardonnay, Pinot Grigio and Sauvignon. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Collio Zuani Riserva
review: Racy acidity and well-knit flavors of creamed pear, chopped hazelnut, baked apricot and lemon meringue balance the rich oak character. The sleek, focused finish is long and smoky. Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Grigio. Drink now through 2025. 300 cases imported.

name: Collio Zuani Riserva
review: Rich and creamy, offering a smoky base note of toasted almond and finely layered flavors of apple tarte Tatin, lemon meringue and ground ginger, with a hint of marzipan. Shows lovely integration of the vibrant acidity throughout. An element of toasted coconut lingers on the finish. Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Grigio. Drink now through 2023. 1,000 cases made.

name: Collio
review: Hints of wax and medicinal herbs underscore this creamy white, which boasts flavors of lemon curd, mineral, white peach, smoke and just a touch of graham cracker. This is deftly integrated, balancing its rich overtones with the fresh, juicy acidity. Lightly honeyed finish. Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Grigio. Drink now through 2016. 100 cases imported.

name: Collio Vigne
review: Lots of dried apricot and peach character. Full-bodied, thick and flavorful, but remains fresh and long. Yummy. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Collio Zuani Riserva
review: Silky and layered, this elegant white offers flavors of creamed pear, salted almond, pastry and ground ginger and cardamom, accented by green hints of rhubarb and freshly chopped herbs. Expressive and finely balanced, presenting a long, creamy finish. Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Grigio. Drink now through 2021. 300 cases imported.

name: Collio Vigne
review: Hints of spice and vanilla mix with flavors of raw almond, creamed apple, stony mineral and fresh herbs in this elegant white, which is bright and expressive, exhibiting good cut through to the lacy finish. Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Grigio. Drink now through 2020. 1,900 cases imported.

name: Collio Zuani Riserva
review: Oak spice, floral and smoke notes accent the flavors of golden apple, cream, lemon parfait and apricot in this light- to medium-bodied white. Fresh, with a subtle, aromatic finish. Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Grigio. Drink now through 2019. 300 cases imported.

name: Collio
review: A subtle white, with pineapple, honeydew melon and mild oak aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with good balance and a fresh, lightly spicy finish. Nicely done. Stylish. Not filtered, so a little cloudy. Equal parts of Tocai Friulano, Chardonnay, Pinot Grigio and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now. 415 cases made.

name: Collio Vigne
review: A well-knit white, fresh and lively, offering flavors of cantaloupe, stone, fresh ginger and kiwifruit in a light-bodied, lithe frame. Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Grigio. Drink now through 2018. 1,900 cases imported.

name: Collio Vigne
review: Fresh and focused, with fine texture and vibrant acidity framing floral, spice, persimmon, poached pear and almond notes. Delivers a mouthwatering, creamy finish. Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Grigio. Drink now through 2017. 5,000 cases made.

name: Collio Vigne
review: Shows fascinating aromas of papaya, cream and aniseed. Full-bodied and a little oily, but there's lots of fruit tart and dried fruits. Stylish. Equal parts of Tocai Friulano, Chardonnay, Pinot Grigio and Sauvignon. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Collio Vigne
review: Light-bodied and balanced, with a floral overtone and flavors of Gala apple, white peach, stone and candied ginger. Shows modest length on the tangy, open-knit finish. Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Grigio. Drink now. 1,900 cases imported.

name: Collio Vigne
review: A light-bodied white, with lightly honeyed flavors of apricot, quince and orange peel. Modest, tangy finish. Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Grigio. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Collio Vigne
review: Pure, lightly spiced grapey fruit on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with clean fruit and good balance. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Collio
review: Lots of wood, with ripe apple and pineapple, as well as burnt caramel. Full-bodied, thick finish. Tocai Friulano, Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Collio Vigne
review: Grapefruit, citrus rind and light mineral character. Crisp, medium body, with tart flavors. Almost off-dry. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Collio
review: A decent white, with some citrus fruit and fresh vanilla pod character. Medium body. Fresh, with a light, slightly lactic finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Collio Vigne
review: A bit earthy at first, but blows off to reveal some nice fresh pear and mineral. Medium-bodied, with a slightly rustic fruit cocktail character. Equal parts of Tocai Friulano, Chardonnay, Pinot Grigio and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now. 4,100 cases made.

name: Collio Vigne
review: Aromas and flavors of grapefruit and apple skin. Medium body. Candied fruit aftertaste. Tocai Friulano, Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Collio
review: A bit cloudy, but some interesting honey, lemon and vanilla character. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and a medium finish. Not stable. Tocai Friulano, Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc. 830 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Dry Agness Wine Cellars
review: On the dry side, though this flirts with a gentler creamed-pear hint that drapes over the core of green apple and fennel notes. Light pine echo on the finish. Drink now. 105 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Niederösterreich
review: Rich and sumptuous, with ripe pear and apple flavors supported by glazed citrus and apricot. The finish is lively and spicy. Drink now through 2015. 225 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Weinviertel Steinbreiten Innere Bergen
review: Deep, concentrated flavors of pear, citrus and spice resonate throughout. Quite big and powerful, with the fruit, acidity and weight all in harmony. Drink now through 2000.

name: Welschriesling Eiswein Weinviertel
review: Delicious. The pear and apricot aromas jump out of the glass in this creamy, racy dessert wine. The sweetness is barely noticeable, it's so vibrant and lithe. Very clean and refreshing. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2008.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Äussere Bergen
review: Has a supple, mouthfilling texture, with rich flavors of peach, apricot, apple pie and allspice. The long, creamy finish completes the package. Drink now through 2011. 208 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal-Innere Bergen
review: Delicious. Fresh and floral, offering peach, smoke and mineral notes on a sleek, vibrant frame. Lovely balance and harmony. Drink now through 2006.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Weinviertel
review: Focused and structured, with green apple, smoke and mineral flavors, which linger with candied apricot notes on the rich finish. Well done for the appellation. Drink now through 2010. 40 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Weinviertel
review: Complex aromas of sweet herbs, apricot, celery and honey settle down to citrus and honey on the palate. Concentrated and sweet, this remains lively and delicate through the lingering finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2005.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Äussere Bergen
review: Well-defined and structured flavors of ripe apple, apricot and peach are joined by notes of white pepper and cream on the plush finish. Drink now through 2012. 417 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Ödfeld
review: Very ripe, displaying peach and vanilla notes, fat even, with moderate structure. Concentrated, but loses some intensity on the finish. Needs a little time to integrate. Drink now through 2006. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal Ödfeld
review: Seductive aromas of tropical fruit, grapefruit and flowers indicate the ripeness of the vintage. More typical lentil and white pepper flavors emerge in this balanced, tasty '00. Drink now through 2004.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal Ödfeld
review: Reticent aromas, yet very ripe and integrated on the palate, with notes of passion fruit, orange and apricot, an unctuous midpalate texture and lively acidity that refreshes on the long finish. Best from 2000 through 2005. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Innere Bergen
review: A bright, balanced white, full-bodied and boasting peach, mineral and white pepper flavors. Good length too. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal-Innere Bergen
review: Off-dry and delicious for its peach, apricot and floral aromas and flavors, riding a firm yet accessible structure. Finishes cleanly, with citrus and mineral accents. Drink now through 2005.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal Ödfeld
review: A soft version, smelling and tasting like flowers and talcum powder, with an underlying note of nectarine. Elegant and refreshing, this is a delightful aperitif. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal Ödfeld
review: Offers nicely ripe fruit flavors, with almond, orange peel and grapefruit character. Medium-bodied, with bright acidity and a long, clean finish.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Süss Niederösterreich Steinbreiten
review: Off-dry, showing baked peach, apricot and apple flavors, with plenty of spice on the finish. Supple and seductive. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2013. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Innere Bergen
review: Rich and spicy, with plenty of green peach, mineral, lemon and lime flavors, seasoned amply with white pepper notes. Peach and apricot elements linger on the firm finish. Drink now. 920 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Schrattenthal
review: Aromas of lemon and white pepper. Tight, almost austere. Appealing for its verve and zip. Finishes with spicy overtones.  Drink now. 280 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal Innere Bergen
review: Bursting with violet, quince and hints of tropical fruit. A juicy Riesling, well balanced and with moderate depth of flavor, finishing on a firm citrus note. Drink now through 2000. 580 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Steinbreiten
review: Plenty of citrus here, bordering on orange, with vanilla and mineral accents. It remains crisp and balanced, with a light- to medium-bodied frame and moderate finish. Drink now through 2007.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich
review: A vibrant, spicy red, with delicious cherry and berry flavors. The refined finish features touches of mocha and cream. Drink now. 1,167 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Lust & Laune
review: Fresh-cut herb and apricot flavors are accented by slate and white pepper notes. Citrusy finish. Drink now. 1,666 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Lust & Laune
review: A straight-ahead Grüner, with white pepper accents to the fresh-squeezed lemon-lime flavors. Finishes with mineral and Granny Smith apple notes. Drink now. 1,666 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel
review: Peppery- and minerally-tasting, with lemon-lime notes. Spicy finish, with hints of sea salt. Drink now through 2010. 1,165 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal-Sechs Viertel
review: Ripe and succulent, exuding peach and nectarine flavors with a hint of grassiness. Shows good focus, with lively acidity leaving a fresh impression. Drink now through 2005. 830 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal Karollen
review: Soft and juicy, offering peach, floral and citrus flavors on a rich texture. The crisp structure emerges on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Pinot Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal Karollen
review: Ripe and generous up front, with pear, quince and a hint of vanilla all underscored by a lemony acidity that carries the flavors through the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2000.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Innere Bergen
review: Very fresh, with good definition to the mineral, pear and gooseberry flavors. Crunchy, spicy notes fill the finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Innere Bergen
review: Juicy and well-structured, showing plenty of lemon-lime and green apple flavors, with a spicy finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2010. 833 cases made.

name: Welschriesling-Müller Thurgau Beerenauslese Weinviertel
review: Ripe and assertive, this moderately sweet white has dried apricot and candied citrus peel notes. Softly structured, it finishes on the short side, with a slight bitterness. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Blauer Portugieser Weinviertel Schrattenthal
