review: Soft and fruity, this quaffable red's cherry and berry flavors are ideal for simple grilled meats. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal Ödfeld
review: A pure style of Chardonnay, displaying apple and pear aromas and flavors, a rich texture and a lingering finish. Everything is balanced by crisp acidity. Drink now through 2000. 330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel
review: A crisp style, with apple and citrus flavors and some savory herbal notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel
review: Fresh, showing citrus and pippin apple flavors, with white pepper and mineral on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 833 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal-Sechs Viertel
review: Lean and lively, boasting a citrus grove of flavors, including orange, grapefruit and lemon, picking up a nutty note on the finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Sechs Vierteln
review: Tasty notes of grapefruit, lentil and a white pepper accent this straightforward, accessible white. It's rich and balanced, with modest concentration. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal
review: Focused and on the wiry side, with cherry and herb flavors supported by a firm structure. Light-bodied and balanced. Drink now through 2005. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal-Innere Bergen
review: Predominately grapefruit flavors and a juicy texture make this '99 white an appealing quaff. Finishes short. Drink now.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal-Steinbreiten
review: A loose-knit, easygoing white with moderate pear and citrus flavors, this leaves a mouthwatering impression. Good aperitif. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Steinbreiten Innere Bergen
review: Thick and oily for a Riesling, with honey and spice, especially clove, aromas and flavors. Medium, in body, acidity and finish.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Schrattenthal
review: Pretty red, with an alluring aroma of spice, with flavors of mocha and raspberry. Short finish. Drink now. 835 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Äussere Bergen
review: A fresh, straightforward white, showing green peach and mineral flavors, with some spice notes on the finish. Drink now. 209 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Lust & Laune
review: A crisp, straightforward style, showing citrus and crunchy apple flavors, with a peppery finish. Drink now. 1,165 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal Ödfeld
review: A suave version, this Grüner Veltliner evokes apple, lentil and lemon character on a creamy texture and firm structure. The acidity sticks out a little on the finish. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Schrattenthal Ödfeld
review: Ripe and round, offering peach and melon, with an underlying tobacco note. Hints of bitterness and citrus lift the finish. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills
review: Dense and chewy, but remarkably agile, displaying ripe blackberry, plum, black pepper, walnut and floral flavors flitting in and out of focus, meeting up with mineral notes on the finish. Best from 2012 through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills
review: Sleek and vibrant, with floral and beet overtones to red berry and plum notes. Shows presence and pretty flavors that linger. Drink now through 2020. 990 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills
review: Smooth, round and generous with its blueberry, plum and dusky spice flavors, offering a velvety mouthful of tightly focused, complex flavors, veering toward welcome mineral notes on the finish. Needs time to expand those characteristics in the bottle. Best from 2011 through 2016. 1,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Whole Cluster
review: Supple and well-built, with expressive dark raspberry and loamy spice aromas leading to open-knit tart plum and black tea flavors. Drink now through 2020. 346 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills
review: Light and open-textured, this expressive red touches on red berry, cinnamon and cream character, playing out over refined tannins. Delicate and harmonious, finishing with style. Drink now through 2019. 1,100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills
review: Light and silky, with pretty orange peel and guava accents to the strawberry fruit, lingering with refinement. Drink now through 2017. 375 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Whole Cluster Project
review: Firm in texture but light on its feet, with pretty cherry and strawberry flavors at the center, persisting nicely on the delicately sharp finish. Drink now through 2016. 160 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Whole Cluster Project
review: Light-footed, with a veil of firm tannins surrounding the cherry and spice flavors, persisting pleasantly. Drink now through 2016. 138 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Eola-Amity Hills
review: Light and sleek, with a racy, metallic edge to the grapefruit flavors. Drink now. 235 cases made.

name: Prosecco All'Omb
review: Fruity, simple Prosecco, with lemon, melon aromas and flavors. Medium body. Medium bead.  Drink now. 8,330 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Ribera del Duero Crianza
review: This plump, supple red overflows with cherry, cooked plum, vanilla and spice flavors, and has just enough tannins for grip.  Drink now through 2007. 12,000 cases made.

name: Veneto Harlequin
review: An enticing, enveloping nose offers prune juice, cinnamon and nutmeg, with citrus peel and vanilla bean notes. Full-bodied, with juicy fruit and red licorice coating the fine, firm tannins. Finishes long, with a fresh, spicy aftertaste. An exotic Veneto red using more than a dozen local and international grape varieties, both red and white. Best after 2010. 250 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Shows a fine marriage between Amarone's more traditional and modern styles. A fresh, medium- to full-bodied red, framed by chalky tannins, this offers a mix of wild herb and underbrush notes, pure, crushed black cherry and pomegranate fruit, tarry mineral and accents of citrus peel, mocha and spice that linger on the well-defined finish. Best from 2018 through 2030. 500 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico La Mattonara Riserva
review: Christmas spice, orange compote, date and plumped cherry flavors lead the way in this bright and lively red, wrapping around and fleshing out the grippy, tannic frame. Tightly meshed and mouthwatering, with savory accents of espresso, iron and grilled herb playing off the fruit and spice notes on the lasting finish. Drink now through 2029. 250 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico La Mattonara Riserva
review: Long and silky, this harmonious red offers fine-grained tannins swathed in flavors of ripe black cherry puree, raspberry ganache, tarry smoke, coffee liqueur and Asian five-spice powder. Dense and focused, with a persistent finish. Drink now through 2033. 20 cases imported.

name: Veneto Harlequin
review: Shows ripe blackberry, with hints of creamy mineral, red licorice and flowers. Full-bodied and silky red, with ripe tannins that provide a round mouthfeel. Has a long finish of fruit and mineral. Delicious now, but you can still hold. Massive. Superb. Best after 2009. 125 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Medicinal herb and spice notes waft through the nose and silky palate of this elegant red, accenting flavors of sun-dried cherry, red currant pâte de fruit, ganache, graphite and fig bread. The fine-grained tannins are supple and well-knit, firming on the lasting, spiced finish. Drink now through 2030. 150 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Notes of graphite, spice and grilled herb lace the flavors of macerated cherry, plum liqueur, fresh forest and dried cranberry in this chewy red, which ends with a mouthwatering finish that echoes ground spice and minerally smoke. Drink now through 2024. 500 cases made.

name: Veneto Harlequin
review: A ripe, rich style, yet well-balanced and juicy throughout, with hints of treacle and smoke underscoring sun-dried cherry, date and dried strawberry fruit, and a thread of ground spice and graphite unraveling on the silky palate through the chewy, lasting finish. Corvina, Corvinone, Rondinella and others. Drink now through 2028. 4 cases imported.

name: Veneto Kairos
review: Rich and creamy flavors of black cherry puree, chocolate liqueur and singed orange peel find harmony in this silky red, layered with vibrant acidity and savory accents of tarry mineral and underbrush. Supple tannins firm on the long, smoky, mouthwatering finish. A blend of 15 grape varieties including Corvina, Corvinone, Rondinella and others. Drink now through 2026. 833 cases made.

name: Veneto Kairos
review: Rich and chewy, this medium- to full-bodied version is underscored by a note of smoky bacon fat and offers an aromatic profile of plumped cherry, dried marjoram, black licorice and cocoa powder. Corvina, Corvinone, Rondinella, Croatina, Cabernet Franc and others. Drink now through 2025. 80 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc-Merlot Veneto 60 20 20
review: Fine-grained tannins frame this well-knit red, which offers an elegant mix of crème de cassis, dried thyme, graphite, fig paste and violet notes. Bright and fragrant, this appealing red is finely balanced and accessible now, but should develop well in the short term. Drink now through 2026. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc-Merlot Veneto 602020
review: A rich red, with medicinal herb, spice and melted licorice accents to the flavors of crème de cassis, graphite, chocolate-covered cherry and smoky mineral. Supple and well-knit , featuring good aromatics on the lasting, chewy finish. Drink now through 2025. 80 cases imported.

name: Oseleta Verona
review: Inviting wild cherry, floral and herb notes are framed by dense, fine-grained tannins in this medium- to full-bodied red. Bright and juicy, with mineral, black licorice and additional cherry flavors on the firm, lasting finish. Should open nicely with some short-term cellaring. Best from 2017 through 2025. 50 cases imported.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore
review: This mouthwatering red features oak spice, mocha-laced cherry, fig cake and dried thyme flavors, with creamy tannins and a subtle hint of smoky mineral. Rich in flavor, but elegant overall. A balanced wine that's hard to stop sipping. Drink now through 2025. 400 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore
review: Abundantly aromatic, with a range of herbes de Provence, dried tea rose, bergamot and spice leading the way, accenting flavors of plump cherry and fresh, loamy earth. Finely knit and mouthwatering, with a lasting, lightly chewy finish. Drink now through 2025. 70 cases imported.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore
review: Lightly chewy tannins and juicy acidity frame this medium-bodied red. Rich in texture, with hints of sun-dried black cherry, grilled plum, smoky mineral and cocoa powder. Drink now through 2018. 850 cases made.

name: Veneto Kairos
review: Refined, well-balanced and creamy, this meshes polished tannins with layers of pure fruit flavor, delivering notes of sun-dried cherry, crème de cassis and pomegranate, accompanied by accents of black licorice, dusty ground anise, tar and bresaola. Corvina, Corvinone, Rondinella and 12 other grape varieties. Drink now through 2018. 750 cases made.

name: Oseleta Verona
review: Chalky tannins and a velvety texture carry subtle flavors of ripe mulberry, star anise, kumquat and herbes de Provence in this lively, medium-bodied red. Chewy finish. Best from 2017 through 2021. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 350 cases made.

name: Veneto From Black to White Il Bianco
review: A fresh and breezy white, with a creamy mix of ripe green melon, chalk, apple blossom and pink grapefruit zest. A pleasing hint of bitterness shows on the clean-cut finish. Harmonious. Rondinella Bianco with Gold Traminer, Kerner and Incrocio Manzoni. Drink now through 2019. 1,333 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: A clean red, with fresh blackberry and mild spice character. Full-bodied, with lots of fresh fruit, fine tannins and a long, mineral finish. Best after 2008. 425 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc-Merlot Veneto 60 20 20
review: Dusty tannins and light acidity provide structure for the spice, dried dill and tomato leaf notes accenting the flavors of dried cherry, cranberry, cassis, chocolate shavings and sweet smoke. Drink now through 2016. 1,000 cases made.

name: Veneto Kairos
review: Offers ripe currant, with floral and spicy notes. Medium- to full-bodied palate, with a good core of fruit and fine tannins followed by a lingering finish. Best after 2009. 850 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Rêverie
review: Light-bodied and crisp, this bright red offers a balanced mix of wild raspberry and citrus notes, with fragrant hints of spice and herb. Fresh and snappy. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Veneto From Black to White Il Bianco
review: Light-bodied and tangy, an easy-drinking white, with flavors of passion fruit, stone, nectarine and grapefruit zest. Rondinella Bianco with Gold Traminer, Kerner and Cross Manzoni. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 250 cases imported.

name: Verona Oz
review: Good nose, with barbecued meat, juniper berry and earthy spice. Full-bodied, tight and firm, finishing with a hint of violet. Just a bit short. Oseleta. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Rêverie
review: Light-bodied and fresh, offering tangy strawberry, white raspberry and herb notes. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Veneto Kairos
review: Juicy cooked plum character. Medium-bodied, clean and fruity. Fun to drink. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Rêverie
review: Candied strawberry and cherry notes are backed by bright, tangy acidity, with spice and smoke accents. Served lightly chilled with salumi. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 120 cases imported.

name: Veneto From Black to White
review: Tangy, with fruit-forward pineapple, mango, tangerine and peach notes. Rondinella White, Kerner, Gold Traminer and Incrocio Manzoni. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Veneto From Black to White
review: There's pleasant peach and cream character, but this is a little flat on the palate, with a dry mineral finish. Made from a local red grape, Rondinella, blended with white varieties. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Appealing for its plum and spice aromas and dried cherry and herb flavors. Drink now through 2016. 17,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Easygoing and juicy, with modest cherry, cinnamon and herb flavors. Drink now through 2016. 15,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Explosively young and juicy, with modest plum and licorice notes. Drink now. 7,351 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Impuls
review: Very ripe, with rich flavors of peach, coconut cream, glazed apricot and hints of butterscotch. The broad finish is quite creamy and lush. Drink now through 2013. 833 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Russian River Valley Barrel Fermented
review: Focused and flavorful, a firm, full-bodied dry Gewürztraminer that displays classic character and depth, echoing rose petal, grapefruit and spice on the long finish. Drink now through 1996. 2,500 cases made.

name: Danato Sonoma-Mendocino Counties
review: This is a tight, firm, intensely flavored wine that delivers spicy berry, pepper and currant notes. Offers a fine balance of fruit, texture and weight and finishes with a burst of fruit and tannins. An intriguing blend of Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon. 400 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Russian River Valley Barrel Fermented Dry
review: A dry, fruity style from California that favors citrus, pineapple and melon flavors—until the finish, which echoes spice. 2,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Russian River Valley
review: A welcome departure from the usual soft, simple California Gewürztraminer. Nearly dry and well made in the style of Alsace. Has rich, assertive, pleasantly bitter varietal flavors of spice and grapefruit and a lingering finish.

name: Gewürztraminer Russian River Valley Martinelli Vineyard Barrel Fermented New Barrel Select
review: Definitely shows the results of barrel fermentation more than the other bottlings, with classic vanilla and spice flavors that overshadow the more delicate Gewürz character. Only a little pear fruit peeks through. An interesting wine, but an odd duck for the varietal. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Russian River Valley Martinelli Vineyard Puncheon Select
review: Dry and spicy, showing a golden pineapple edge to the resiny notes. Drink with herb-flavored foods. 415 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Smooth, soft, nutty and buttery, an easy-drinking Chardonnay that leans toward the rich, mature end of the flavor spectrum. 300 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Russian River Valley McIlroy/Martinelli Barrel Fermented Puncheon Select
review: Modest and restrained in both aroma and flavor, this lightly floral wine comes off as dry and refreshing, but curiously lacking in Gewürztraminer character. Drink now. 430 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Clockspring Vineyard Old Vine
review: Dried berry, roast plum and loads of cedary oak have very good intensity, with lively structure to pastry dough and black pepper flavors. Drink now through 2006. 243 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Clockspring Vineyard Old Vine
review: Distinctive for its loamy raspberry and white pepper notes. Finishes with drying, cedary tannins. Drink now through 2014. 1,288 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Brsada Vineyard
review: Zesty and spicy, with modest dried plum and herb flavors. Drink now through 2014. 448 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi
review: Offers modest dried cherry and spice flavors. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Agnes' Vineyard Old Vine
review: Lean and earthy, with black cherry and herb aromas and cooked fruit and vegetal flavors. 2,039 cases made.

name: Garnacha Navarra Rosado
review: Berry and bell pepper flavors mingle in this dark, thick rosé. A light spritz gives lift, but this is still ponderous. 5,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: A new brand from Gallo that features soft, ripe, slightly jammy, smoky, wild berry flavors and supple tannins. It's a style that's quite drinkable now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Medium-bodied, with ripe black cherry and hints of tea and pepper, finishing with firm tannins. Drink now. 26,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Here's a deal in quality California Pinot. Enters with earth and cola notes, and stretches out with plum and wintergreen flavors. Not a blockbuster, but a pleasing, delicate wine at an equally appealing price. 14,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
review: Extremely bright acidity is the hallmark of this lemony wine. Firm-textured and full-bodied, it finishes with a spicy air. 22,000 cases made.

name: Nero d'Avola Terre Siciliane Chiantari
review: A well-knit red, with lightly chewy tannins and accents of mocha and wild herb lacing the ripe mulberry and plum fruit. Balanced and medium-bodied, with a lingering, smoky finish. Drink now through 2020. 10,000 cases made.

name: Nero d'Avola Terre Siciliane
review: A juicy, medium-bodied red, with supple tannins and a pure and pretty note of ripe wild cherry. Hints of stone, star anise and espresso accent the fruit and linger on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 40,000 cases made.

name: Nerello Mascalese Terre Siciliane Il Passo
review: Floral and spice notes lead to candied black raspberry, citrus and mocha flavors in this round, ripe, medium-bodied version. Chewy. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Nero d'Avola Terre Siciliane
review: An oaky red, with lots of bacon fat and spice notes layered with subtle flavors of brambly cherry, berry, dried herb and mocha. Drink now. 2,400 cases imported.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Zaca Vineyards
review: An outstanding Syrah from this California winery. Rich and fruity, with gobs of ripe cherry, wild berry, currant and raspberry flavors. It picks up anise, cedar and spice notes, then turns smooth and complex on the finish. The tannins are fine and the flavors keep pouring through. Achieves its rich character without the heavy feel. 3,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County American Reserve
review: Full flavored and fragant, complex earthy; a delicious Pinot Noir.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Offering wonderful floral, grapey plum and wild berry aromas, this is rich, smooth and supple on the palate, with tiers of dark berry, mocha, mineral and spice flavors that glide along. Drink now through 2015. 12,325 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Mesa Reserve
review: Tightly wound, firm and concentrated, with trim yet concentrated dried berry, tobacco, mineral, cedar, beef carpaccio and roasted herb flavors that are very complex and focused, yet backward and in need of either a long decant or cellar time. Best from 2012 through 2022. 992 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Tight and beefy, with focused blueberry and wild berry flavors that are spicy and complex. Full-bodied, with a hint of stewed plum and wild berry peaking through on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 13,090 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Black Bear Block
review: Delivers a pure, rich, spicy mix of peppery wild berry, cedar, dried herb and underbrush flavors, firming nicely on the long, full finish. Drink now through 2022. 367 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Black Bear Block
review: Intense and tightly focused on spicy, beefy, peppery Syrah flavors, presented in a full-bodied style, with richness, depth, concentration and complexity, ending with excellent structure. Drink now through 2015. 484 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Eight Barrel
review: Tight and snappy, with a loamy earth edge to the vivid wild berry and blackberry flavors. Ends with a mix of refreshing fruit and mineral. Drink now through 2020. 392 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Mesa Reserve
review: Fresh, snappy and vivid, this red zeros in on a tightly focused beam of wild berry and raspberry flavors, ending with a mouthwatering aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 696 cases made.

name: Z Three Santa Ynez Valley
review: Very intense and richly flavored, with vibrant, spicy wild berry, beef carpaccio, melted chocolate, black licorice and savory notes. Full-bodied, very young and concentrated. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2020. 1,253 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County Reserve
review: Very toasty and spicy, yet smooth as silk on the palate. Aromas and flavors of cinnamon, strawberry and raspberry are nicely supported by the right frame of oak. Superb balance.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Alumni Winemaker Series James A. Clendenen
review: Ripe, creamy and supple with extra dimensions, offering apricot, pear and vanilla flavors that swirl through the finish. Drinkable now. 500 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Alumni Winemaker Series Bob Lindquist
review: Ripe, round, generous and complex, bursting with blackberry, black cherry, black pepper and anise flavors and a lively finish. Best from 1997. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Black Bear Block
review: Firm, intense and spicy, with rich blackberry, hot brick, cedar, graphite and sage notes. Full-bodied and tannic, combining to give the flavors traction and depth. Drink now through 2022. 329 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Chapel G
review: Refined and well-focused, showing dusty raspberry and sweet anise aromas and layered flavors of cherry, orange zest and pepper. Drink now through 2024. 603 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Eight Barrel
review: Rich, intense, broad and deep, showing ripe blackberry and wild berry flavors, with hints of anise, sage, tar and tobacco. Ends with a long, intense, persistent finish. Drink now through 2017. 581 cases made.

name: Z Three Santa Ynez Valley
review: Appealingly dense and focused. Savory aromas of smoky herb and raspberry lead to zesty flavors of plum, anise and cedar. The tannins are ripe but have a pleasant mineral accent. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2023. 452 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Zaca Vineyards
review: Bright and lively, with distinctly spicy tangerine, nectarine and peach flavors that are smooth and concentrated, finishing with a long, spicy aftertaste. 20,000 cases made.

name: Mourvèdre Santa Ynez Valley
review: Full-bodied, ripe and fleshy, with supple plum, wild berry and huckleberry fruit that's fresh, focused and smooth-textured. Drink now through 2012. 413 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Zaca Vineyards
review: Dark and spicy, with an earthy accent to its wild berry and cherry flavors. Picks up a leathery edge on the finish, and it's firmly tannic, so cellaring into 1998 or '99 is advised. 2,700 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Black Bear Block
review: A big, beefy red, featuring bold aromas of spicy smoked meat and blackberry, with full-bodied flavors of dark plum, sage and cedar. The tannins firm up the finish. Best from 2017 through 2023. 364 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Mesa Reserve
review: Strikes a nice balance between intensity and finesse, with spicy, beefy, peppery berry flavors that show touches of cumin and cedar, then fan out nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 690 cases made.

name: Z Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Offers a mix of peach, melon and lemon notes, with crisp acidity and spice and floral details, revealing plenty of citrus zest accents on the finish. Roussanne, Grenache Blanc and Viognier. Drink now. 971 cases made.

name: Z Three Santa Ynez Valley
review: Combines ripe, plump, spicy blueberry, mineral, graphite, pepper and savory roasted herb flavors. Full-bodied, ending with pebble and spice notes. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2019. 730 cases made.

name: Z Three Santa Ynez Valley
review: A racy style, intense and marked by peppery wild berry, mineral, sage and cedar notes that gain depth and velocity, while retaining a firm structure. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2016. 1,155 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
review: Tight and lemony, with reined-in citrus, pear and apple notes, but reveals more richness and depth on the finish and the flavors stay with you. Drink now. 15,763 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Alumni Winemaker Series James A. Clendenen
review: A woody style, with spicy pear, butterscotch and honeyed notes that manage to stand up to oak. Loses some of its intensity and richness on the finish. 402 cases made.

name: Cuvee Z Santa Barbara County
review: Impressive for its range of complex flavors, it blends together dried cherry, wild berry, spice and cranberry, with hints of sage and cedar. Finishes with mild yet firm tannins. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah, Cinsault and Counoise. Drink now through 2004. 6,850 cases made.

name: Cuvee Z Santa Barbara County
review: Ripe, rich and exotic. Layers of ripe plum, cherry, anise and spice flavors finish with a slight meaty edge. Drink now or age short-term. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah and Cinsault. 2,600 cases made.

name: Mourvèdre Santa Ynez Valley
review: Intense, with spice, beef, pepper, tar and leather flavors that are firm and structured, framed by firm tannins and ending with a tarry minerality. Decant for now. Drink now through 2015. 378 cases made.

name: Roussanne Santa Barbara County Zaca Vineyards
review: A blend of tropical fruits comes to mind--papaya, mango, oranges and lemons. Lingers nicely on the finish, with tangy acidity. Drink now.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Alumni Winemaker Series Bob Lindquist
review: Somewhat leathery, herbal and earthy, but enough smoky plum and cherry flavors linger on the finish, where it gains a meaty, peppery, tannic edge. Drinkable now. 413 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Zaca Vineyards
review: Intense, with pronounced game, lead pencil and black cherry flavors, all framed by round, ripe tannins. Drink now through 2005. 3,400 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Zaca Vineyards
review: Clean, ripe and juicy, with a core of beefy, meaty currant and blackberry flavors, turning elegant and supple on the finish. Drinks well now, but can age a year or two. 4,300 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Appealing, with wild berry and toasted herb aromas and zesty, well-layered flavors of plum, roasted anise and pepper. Drink now through 2021. 12,400 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Marked by complex, dense flavors of blackberry, wild berry, mineral, dried herb and sage. Full-bodied, with a dry, spicy, lingering finish. Drink now through 2017. 8,316 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Intense black cherry, beef, spice and herb tones have firm, stylish tannins and bracing acidity. Concentration lingers, along with toasty oak, in a ripe, flavorful finish. Drink now through 2008. 5,446 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Black Bear Block
review: A solid effort, offering good structure and accents of boysenberry, river rock, cedar and grilled herb. Drink now through 2027. 124 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Eight Barrel
review: Firm, tight and concentrated, showing a band of leathery currant, dried herb, sage, cedar and spice flavors. Full-bodied, ending with chewy tannins. Best from 2012 through 2020. 498 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Mesa Reserve
review: Aromas of smoky plum and grilled herb give over to concentrated, focused flavors of dried sage, currant and tobacco. Drink now through 2023. 1,026 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley
review: Clean and crisp, mixing white grapefruit, apple and peach flavors, accented by toast and dried floral notes. Refreshing finish. Drink now. 8,576 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley
review: Crisp and refreshing, this offers a mix of lemon, grapefruit and apple flavors, with floral and mineral accents on the finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley
review: A smooth and elegant white, offering lemon, grapefruit and green apple flavors that show details of apple blossom and celery leaf. The lush body is accented by bracing acidity and a clean finish. Drink now. 6,182 cases made.

name: Z Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Pear, spice and almond skin notes are complex and rich, with grapefruit zest and dried floral accents on the juicy finish. Roussanne, Grenache Blanc and Viognier. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Z Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Rich and round, with lush pineapple, apricot and peach flavors on a smooth body. Hints of spice and dried flowers gain momentum on the refreshing finish. Roussanne, Grenache Blanc and Viognier. Drink now through 2020. 1,815 cases made.

name: Nemea Symmetry
review: Medium-bodied, with red plum and dried berry flavors. Some leafy notes carry through to the slightly smoky finish. Agiorgitiko. Drink now. 130,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Péloponnèse Symmetry
review: Medium-bodied, with dried berry flavors and leafy notes on the finish. Drink now. 3,330 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Péloponnèse Symmetry
review: Medium-bodied, straightforward white, with apple and ripe pear flavors leading into a spicy finish. Drink now. 3,330 cases made.

name: Merlot Péloponnèse Symmetry
review: Soft, offering plum and currant flavors, with a short finish. Drink now through . 3,330 cases made.

name: Roditis-Moscofilero Péloponnèse Ambelos Phos
review: Ripe, with tropical fruit flavors that are a touch cloying. Drink now. 2,350 cases imported.

name: Syrah Péloponnèse Symmetry
review: A touch astringent, offering dried berry flavors matched with smoky notes. 21,350 cases made.

name: Syrah Spring Mountain District Crowley Vineyard
review: Spice, dusty berry, new leather and fresh earth aromas carry over to the palate, making this an intense, balanced and easy-drinking wine that offers depth and complexity. Drink now through 2012. 103 cases made.

name: Syrah Knights Valley Lawer Vineyard
review: Appealing beefy, peppery scents carry over to the palate, joined by rich berry and black cherry fruit that marries well with the spicy nuances. Complex, well-proportioned finish. Decant. Drink now through 2011. 144 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder Wall Vineyard
review: Dark-hued, rich and exotic, with a core of ripe currant, blackberry and plum fruit, picking up mineral and sage notes. The tannins are intense and gripping on the finish, where cedary oak is folded in, giving this a nutty edge. Best from 2008 through 2013. 48 cases made.

name: Syrah Knights Valley
review: Nicely structured, with appealing blackberry and espresso aromas and focused black cherry, pencil lead and beefy flavors. Drink now through 2010. 236 cases made.

name: Viognier Knights Valley
review: Wonderfully fragrant and charming, with floral lavender and honeysuckle notes. Ripe peach and apple flavors are direct and tasty, with good acidity to round things out. Drink now. 124 cases made.

name: Viognier Knights Valley
review: Ripe and juicy, with pineapple, mango and papaya notes and a vibrant acidity. Intriguing slate and matchstick notes linger on the finish. Drink now. 83 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Old Mission Peninsula
review: Rosé in color, with some light, tart cherry flavor and a crisp finish. Clean, but no guts whatsoever. 2,400 cases made.

name: Riesling Old Mission Peninsula Late Harvest
review: Has some pine and baked apple notes, turning a bit cidery on the finish. 2,400 cases made.

name: Limniona Tyrnavos
review: This has a bright vein of mineral-driven acidity to the dried berry, red currant and sanguine flavors, featuring some loamy notes. Offers a surprisingly supple finish, with sanguine accents. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Malagousia Tyrnavos
review: This shows good depth to the minerally pear, green apple and grapefruit flavors. Dried bay leaf and lemongrass notes appear on the vibrant finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Limniona Tyrnavos Rosé
review: The cherry and dried berry flavors feature some meaty notes. Allspice accents show on the textured finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Grande Reserve
review: Very minerally and smoky, filled with juicy fruit flavors of peach, apple, grapefruit and mango. The powerful finish features cream, honey and butterscotch. Grüner Veltliner, Riesling, Weissburgunder, Rotgipfler, Zierfandler, Traminer, Pinot Gris, Neuburger and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2014. 500 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Schloss Schönbrunn
review: This medium-bodied white offers zesty citrus flavors, including Meyer lemon and ruby grapefruit. There's good length on the rich, spicy finish. Grüner Veltliner, Weissburgunder, Riesling and Chardonnay. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien
review: A refined white, showing plenty of crisp acidity behind the fresh-cut apple, citrus and spice flavors. The crunchy finish features hints of fresh-cut grass. Grüner Veltliner, Riesling and Chardonnay. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Antares Grande Reserve
review: A tannic, mocha-filled red, with lots of dried raspberry and cherry flavors. Dark chocolate lingers on the taut finish. Saint Laurent, Zweigelt, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Schloss Schönbrunn Rotleiten
review: Like biting into a chocolate-covered cherry, this wine is juicy and a touch candied, but within bounds. Offers a fresh, spicy finish. Saint Laurent, Zweigelt and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Komposition
review: A medium-bodied red, with a meaty aroma and dried plum and spice flavors. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch and Saint Laurent. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Vineyard Georges III
review: Tight and firm, with dried herb, cedar, dried currant and mineral-pebble notes that gain complexity and depth, while maintaining a tight structure. Best from 2010 through 2016. 854 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley Oat Hill Estate
review: Soft and jammy, with spicy baked cherry pie aromas and supple plum, smoky anise and sage flavors. Drink now through 2010. 382 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Beckstoffer Vineyard Georges III
review: Streamlined, with a core of ripe blackberry, currant and plum flavors. Earthiness and fresh herb tones weave into cedary oak and tannins that ramp up on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 425 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Framed by cedary, spicy, toasty oak, enough ripe plum and wild berry fruit flavors fill in the gaps to give this wine depth and complexity. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Beckstoffer Vineyard Georges III
review: Broad shouldered and concentrated, with blackberry, currant and roasted herb flavors, finishing with a green edge. Cedary oak and solid tannin accent the nicely focused finish. Drink now through 2007. 880 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc-Torrontés Mendoza
review: Soft and forward, featuring friendly peach and pineapple notes backed by a dash of honeysuckle. Slightly off-dry in feel. Drink now. 4,050 cases imported.

name: Malbec-Bonarda Mendoza
review: Forward, with a medium-weight mix of plum, rhubarb and cherry fruit, backed by a twinge of raisin on the finish. Drink now. 6,750 cases imported.

name: Alentejo
review: A big, chunky red, with reduced aroma and concentrated flavors of dark plum and cassis, with plenty of espresso and bittersweet chocolate notes mixed in. Impressive effort. Best from 2003 through 2006. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Seductive and smoky, with a range of spice notes to complement the apple and citrus flavors. Balanced, and the flavors persist on the finish. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: A full-bodied, textural white exhibiting ripe apple, pear and almost a red fruit character. The firm finish keeps it in balance. Rich enough to pair with food. Drink now.

name: Merlot Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Firm and fruity, with tart black cherry and strawberry flavors. Quite tannic, though balanced. A nice expression of pure fruit flavor.

name: Pinot Grigio Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Exhibits maturity and some red berry character in addition to the marzipan and apple flavors. Much better than a sample reviewed last year. Drink now.

name: Merlot Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Bright cassis and vanilla aromas greet the senses in this medium-weight wine. Lively acidity and modest tannins suggest pairing with light dishes. Drink now.

name: Tocai Friulano Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: This wine has some structure and character. On the herbal side, with a slice of onion to boot, and some good peach flavors as well.

name: Chardonnay Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Light and lively, with a distinctive ginger-spicy note to the flavors that would make this more appealing as an apéritif than with dinner. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Smooth, ripe and spicy, with a generous beam of anise- and herb-scented apple flavor running through it, turning toward vanilla and eucalyptus on the finish. Drinkable now.

name: Tocai Friulano Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Fresh, crisp and lively, with vibrant lime, apple, and pear flavors; lean but appealing. 830 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Perfumed, with some floral, apricot notes that are decent, but with a hard and tart edge. 830 cases made.

name: Secco Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro La Grasparossa
review: The ripe mulberry and black raspberry flavors are bright and tangy in this well-balanced Lambrusco, laced with notes of creamy black licorice, herbed olive and sweet smoke. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Secco Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Graspaoro
review: Lithe and lively, with flavors of white cherry, tangy blackberry, star anise and stone. Open-knit finish. Drink now. 3,333 cases made.

name: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Piè Franco
review: Savory smoke and leather notes overshadow sweet hints of date and baked cherry in this dry, broad-shouldered Lambrusco. The finely knit mousse softens the firm acidity and light tannins emerge on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pignoletto Secco Emilia
review: Bright and floral, this easy-drinking sparkler offers pear, tangerine and apple blossom notes. Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Robertson Astonvale
review: Straightforward lemon and lime flavor, with a short, tart finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Robertson Astonvale
review: Trim, with modest strawberry and rhubarb fruit, turning light on the short finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc Robertson Astonvale Crème
review: A slightly dilute mix of earth and lemon flavors, with a coarse finish. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz Robertson Astonvale Old Paddock
review: Thin, with prune and menthol notes and a muddled finish. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Robertson
review: Old and tired. Barely drinkable. Tea, tobacco and coffee grinds.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Redolent of boysenberry and blueberry, with cedar and allspice notes. Leafy and hot stone details show on the slate-filled finish. Drink now through 2018. 12,000 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: An exuberantly fruity and stylish red, displaying a brambly mix of boysenberry and red plum flavors balanced by fresh acidity. The minerally finish features notes of white pepper and allspice. Drink now through 2018. 12,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Shows hints of richness to the white peach, Gala apple and white plum flavors, delivering a lively crispness. Notes of green tea and white pepper show on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 15,000 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: A sinewy red, showing good concentration to the violet, dried berry and wild sage notes. Humus and mineral accents build at midpalate, lingering on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2015. 15,000 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: The juicy red fruit flavors are dominated by red plum and raspberry in this red, supported by firm acidity. Slate and mushroom notes linger on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 15,000 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Reserve
review: A Sacher torte of a red. Balanced and structured, this has plenty of dark chocolate and red raspberry flavors. Supple mocha notes and a good dose of tannins fill the finish. Drink now through 2008. 4,165 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: A minty note runs through this well-crafted red that is filled with lots of fresh berry and crushed red fruit flavors. Spicy finish. Drink now. 6,250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Medium-bodied, with firm acidity to the fresh-cut apple, grapefruit and wild plum flavors that show notes of lemon curd. Features sea salt on the finish. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Muskat Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Displays a very spicy aroma, with fresh flavors of peach, apricot and gooseberry. Mineral and citrus notes enliven the finish. Try as an aperitif. Drink now through 2010. 2,083 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: The red plum and ripe berry flavors are leafy and feature some forest floor accents. The juicy finish shows sandalwood notes. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Firm and savory, with plenty of ripe fruit flavors that are fresh, spicy and crisp. Some creamy notes linger on the juicy finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: A zesty white, with notes of scallion and green herb to the apple and ripe lime flavors. Crunchy finish.  Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: In this juicy, medium-bodied red, plum and red berry flavors are matched to hints of cream and plenty of spice. Dried blackberry on the finish.  Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Shows plenty of graphite and iron accents to the dried berry and plum flavors, amply supported by crisp acidity. The taut finish is sinewy, filled with peppery notes. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Very fruity, with blueberry, red plum and currant flavors. Well-structured, with a finish of chocolate mousse backed by medium-grained tannins. Drink now through 2012. 12,500 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Black cherry and leather notes grace this lean red. It's light- to medium-bodied, with a touch of heat on the finish. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Reserve
review: A beefy blend of blackberry and plum flavors augmented by spicy accents. Solid and comforting. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch, Saint Laurent and Pinot Noir. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2005.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: There's lots of fresh baked cherry pie and plum flavors in this medium-bodied red, with milk chocolate on the finish. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Crisp, with loads of red plum, blackberry and spice flavors. Finishes with chocolate and black licorice notes. Drink now through 2010. 8,333 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Aroma and flavor of violets adds an extra dimension to the blackberry note in this pure and focused yet robust red. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Muskat Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Full-bodied and slightly exotic-tasting, with a mix of Asian five-spice and nectarine flavors followed by notes of baked pineapple on the finish. Drink now. 2,083 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: A sinewy red, with a good bite to the wild plum and herb flavors, accented by minerally notes. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: This has a minerally and peppery character to its fresh berry and plum flavors, with a firm finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Exotic, this shows wild berry and cherry flavors, good concentration and firm tannins. Enjoy now with food, or give it some time to soften.  Drink now through 2006.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: A taut red, with dried cherry and plum flavors, and plenty of acidity on the herbal finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Medium-bodied, offering red plum and berry flavors, with some leafy notes on the crisp finish. 6,665 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Reserve
review: Medium-bodied, yet no shortage of intensity in this cherry-flavored red. Its firm tannins add texture and it picks up a smoky note on the finish. Zweigelt, Saint Laurent, Blaufränkisch and Pinot Noir. Drink now.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Taut, with some green herbal notes to the straightforward red fruit flavors. Peppery finish.  Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Muskat Burgenland
review: An aromatic white, with white berry flavors and slate, with some sea salt notes. Short finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Medium-bodied, with cherry and strawberry flavors. Crisp finish with some herbal touches. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Straightforward, with plum and berry flavors, and some raspberry notes on the finish. Drink now. 8,335 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Chocolate covered cherry flavors dominate this medium-bodied red. Zippy finish features raspberry notes. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Plum, berry and mineral flavors, which linger on the broad finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Medium-bodied, with straightforward red plum and berry flavors. Drink now. 6,667 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Burgenland
review: Very herbal and green-tasting. Chalky finish. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sandra Horse Heaven Hills
review: Velvety and generous. A plush mouthful of blueberry, plum, cream and dark chocolate flavors that echo through the long, resonant finish. Strikes a superb balance between rich fruit, savory side notes and good depth. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Syrah. Best from 2009 through 2017. 425 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Playa Sol
review: Bright and zingy, delivering a lively mouthful of pear, grapefruit, peach and spice flavors, harmonious right through the long, vivid finish. Drink now through 2013. 200 cases made.

name: Sandra Aldercreek Vineyard Horse Heaven Hills
review: A distinctive minerality, reminiscent of warm rain on flagstones, runs through the flavor profile of this elegant, refined and powerful red. Dark berry and licorice notes also come through as the finish persists. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2016. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 900 cases made.

name: Sandra Aldercreek Vineyard Horse Heaven Hills
review: Dense, dark and chewy, this is beautifully aromatic, showing impressive depth to its black cherry, pepper and bay leaf flavors, hinting at licorice as the finish sails on against well-modulated tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2010 through 2016. 1,050 cases made.

name: Casima Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and velvety, this lets its tobacco- and black olive-tinged cherry and spice flavors emerge easily, lingering on the generous finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2014. 525 cases made.

name: Casima Columbia Valley
review: Rich and aromatic, bursting with sandalwood and mocha-accented blueberry and cherry flavors, nicely wrapped in fine, crisp tannins. The fruit lingers beautifully on the long finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Sangiovese. Best from 2008 through 2013. 425 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Playa Sol
review: Bright and lively, this steely wine bursts with lemon-accented quince and melon flavors, wrapping the expressive finish with a touch of welcome minerality. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases made.

name: Sandra Horse Heaven Hills
review: Ripe, focused, seductive and generous with its sweet, leathery plum and currant flavors, which linger on the polished finish, spreading nicely across the palate as it stays with you nicely. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Syrah. Drink now through 2012. 375 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Long Wide Life
review: Smooth and spicy, with an earthy, loamy tobacco cast to the ripe wild blueberry flavors, persisting into the lithe and balanced finish. Drink now through 2016. 100 cases made.

name: Gabi Columbia Valley
review: Lithe, creamy and distinctive for its herbal pear, spice and custard cream flavors, lingering on the polished finish. Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. Drink now through 2011. 165 cases made.

name: Sandra Columbia Valley
review: Dense and beautifully focused, a lively mouthful of currant, black cherry and delicately herbal nuances, finishing with a smoky, meaty note. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Syrah. Best from 2006 through 2011. 225 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Playa Sol
review: Ripe and spicy, with pepper and nutmeg accents to the pear, pineapple and cream flavors, lingering on the slightly charry finish. Drink now through 2011. 200 cases made.

name: Sandra Horse Heaven Hills
review: Fairly firm in texture for a non-vintage red, this can use some time to soften and develop its ripe black cherry and smoky red pepper flavors, which persist on the generous finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2012. 50 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley Gabi
review: Bright and lively, juicy with tangy grapefruit and pineapple flavors, persisting nicely on the finish. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Casima Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with chewy tannins around a modest core of black fruit and spice. Lingers gently. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2013 through 2016. 350 cases made.

name: Casima Columbia Valley
review: Velvety and nicely focused, delivering a layered mouthful of red plum, floral and green berry flavors, lingering on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Sangiovese. Drink now through 2014. 375 cases made.

name: Casima Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and appealing for its earthy currant flavors and chewy texture, with the fruit coming through nicely as the finish lingers. Needs time to soften. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Sangiovese. Best after 2007. 100 cases made.

name: Sandra Aldercreek Vineyard Horse Heaven Hills
review: Supple in texture, this earthy red borders on gamy in flavor, with dark berry notes coming through on the finish. Not as pure and refined as previous vintages. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Syrah. Best from 2011 through 2015. 900 cases made.

name: Brut Conegliano Valdobbiadene Tre Venti
review: Pretty floral, apricot and apple notes mix with hints of lemongrass, fresh ginger, blanched almond and zesty mineral in this elegant version. Lightly mouthwatering, with a clean finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,600 cases made.

name: Dry Conegliano Valdobbiadene Z Zeta
review: Elegant, this offers fine balance between lightly mouthwatering acidity, rich notes of candied orange zest and crystallized honey, and flavors of peach, graham cracker and ground ginger. Drink now through 2016. 10,000 cases made.

name: Dry Conegliano Valdobbiadene Zeta
review: This fresh, floral Prosecco shows fine balance and flavors of white peach, jasmine, star anise and pear that are bright and expressive, riding the lively bead. Drink now through 2018. 10,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco di Conegliano-Valdobbiadene Tre Venti
review: Lightly tangy, with a hint of smoke underscoring the balanced palate of crunchy green pear, tangerine, peach skin and spice. Stone-tinged finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Dry Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore Z Zeta
review: Delicate in texture, with good zip to the acidity, balancing rich notes of almond paste, poached peach, spun honey and melon sorbet. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Dry Prosecco di Conegliano-Valdobbiadene Z Zeta
review: Juicy, with a balanced mix of simple syrup, poached pear, verbena, apricot and candied ginger. The lively bead carries the zesty finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Brut Conegliano Valdobbiadene Tre Venti
review: This is well-knit and fresh, with a stony underpinning and hints of crunchy white peach and lemon curd. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco
review: Here's a value worth celebrating: a thick, full-bodied sparkler with a bountiful honeydew character, light bead and fresh finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco
review: Lots of apple and cream up front, with a medium froth and a clean grapefruit and mineral finish. Drink now. 125,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco
review: Firm, with a refined bead and subtle notes of blanched almond, honeysuckle, quince and zesty spice. Crisp finish. Drink now. 90,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco di Conegliano Z Zeta
review: Bright apple and pear character, with lots of froth. Fresh, well-balanced and delicious. Drink now. 8,330 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco
review: A dry and easy-drinking Prosecco, with an airy mousse, this offers hints of juicy pear, verbena and almond. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco di Conegliano
review: A lovely wine with lemon and blanched almonds on the nose and palate. Medium body and fine bead, with a refreshing aftertaste. Always a good value. Drink now. 41,665 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco Treviso
review: Open-knit and fresh, this pretty Prosecco offers Asian pear, floral, ground spice and lemon pith flavors. Drink now. 90,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Vino Spumante
review: Aromatic, with spice and floral notes, offering hints of dried cherry, candied black currant and gumdrop. Features a lightly juicy finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Brut Vino Spumante Private Cuvée
review: Starts nicely, with heather, apple and cream on the nose. Medium-bodied, with a gentle fizz, leaving a hint of fresh cream on the delicate finish. Prosecco, Chardonnay, Moscato and others. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco Made with Organic Grapes
review: Sleek and tangy, with a lively mousse, a smoky base and hints of mandarin orange peel and glazed apricot. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco Treviso
review: Fresh and floral, with good zip. The easy-drinking notes of apple and white peach lose some steam toward the finish. Drink now. 90,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco Treviso Organic
review: A crisp version, with a lively mousse and flavors of Key lime pie, stone and ground ginger. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brut Vino Spumante Private Cuvée
review: Open-knit, with lively pineapple, yellow apple, apricot, apple blossom and candied cherry notes. Clean finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Brut Vino Spumante Private Cuvée
review: A dry, spicy version, with moderate notes of ripe green pear, blood orange, stone and pickled ginger. Fresh. Drink now. 21,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry Rosé Vino Spumante
review: Bright and tangy, this easy-drinking sparkler offers a ripe mix of strawberry puree, candied ginger, mandarin orange peel and red licorice notes backed by juicy acidity. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco di Conegliano
review: A light, fruity and fresh sparkling wine, with bananalike flavors and slight sweetness. Charming but simple.

name: Brut Prosecco di Conegliano
review: Simple and light. Not much character, but clean and refreshing. Drink now. 70,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco di Conegliano Zeroventi
review: Good, basic Prosecco. Clean, with apple and a hint of dough, balanced froth and a crisp finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Brut Vino Spumante Private Cuvée
review: Light-bodied and bright, with candied apple, pineapple and tangerine notes. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco di Conegliano Z Zeta
review: Flat, with plastic character. There's some lemon fruit underneath, but this is disappointing. 8,500 cases made.

name: Brut Prosecco di Conegliano
review: Light and bubbly, with modest earth and apple flavors. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Medium bodied with a toasty caramel edge to the ripe pear flavors. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Ripe, bold and creamy describes this California Chardonnay, with its rich character of fig, pear, vanilla, melon and spice. Picks up tropical fruit notes, with pineapple and guava singing on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: This wine grows on you, revealing both rich and subtle flavor nuances that spread out nicely. Built around a core of ripe cherry, wild berry and blackberry fruit, it picks up hints of sour cherry candy, currant, anise and cedary oak. The long, complex finish is supported by firm but ripe and polished tannins. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Smooth, ripe, rich and polished, with currant, cherry, coffee, prune and tobacco flavors, turning silky and supple on the long, rich aftertaste. Best from 2000 through 2009. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Founder's Reserve
review: Combines fresh earth, dried berry, cedar, tar and raspberry flavors that are intense, concentrated and firmly tannic, but the fruit pushes through in an impressive manner, ending with a long, persistent finish that should reward cellaring. Best from 2011 through 2019. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Dark, ripe, rich and chocolaty, with a slight leather accent to the dense currant, plum and spicy herbal flavors. Finishes with a complex aftertaste. Best from 2001 through 2008. 2,836 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Estate Bottled
review: Tough and earthy, with a powerful structure and broad, juicy black cherry and tobacco flavor. There is nothing elegant about it, but time should polish the tannins and make this a complex, enjoyable wine. Start drinking in 1997 to 2000. 316 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Tightly wound, firm and compact, with ripe, floral, plum and berry flavors; turns rich with mineral and spicy notes. Muscular but ripe, rustic tannins finish it off. Best into 2000. 620 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Well-oaked, but also well done, with spicy, toasty, cedary woody flavors matched with ripe, intense citrus and tropical notes that are clean and refreshing. Drink now through 2012. 1,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A trim, supple, well-balanced wine, with cedary currant, dill, blackberry and black cherry fruit that gains velocity and shows off extra flavor and depth dimensions. Intense, with a touch of heat, the tannins are well-integrated. Best from 2004 through 2010. 4,957 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Racy, with a citrus edge to the core of pear and sweet pea flavors, it turns diffuse on the finish but holds its flavors. Light oak in the background. Drink now through 2001. 16,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Lean and woody, with lively acidity, enough varietal fruit and spice, and a definite frame of oak, all in a concentrated, well knit package, muscular but graceful. Should develop more depth with a year or two againg.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm, with crisp tannins, and tightly wound flavors of currant and cherry that pick up an earthy, leathery edge. Best to cellar into 1999 to 2002. 2,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Abacus
review: Tight and focused, with complex earthy currant, black cherry, anise, herb and leathery notes, firming on the finish, picking up a chocolate note. A curious and expensive foray into non-vintage "solera-style" Cabernet, it's a multiple vintage blend of every ZD Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon ever produced. This is the second bottling, a blend from 1992-1999. Best from 2002 through 2010.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Just shy of outstanding. This wine has a lot going for it—elegance, a range of spicy currant, cherry, berry and light oak shadings. Needs only a little more richness and concentration.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Complex and harmonious, as aromas of smoky oak, mushroom and cherry follow through with those flavors on the palate. Finishes with plush tannins and good length. Best to cellar into 1998. 217 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Intense and concentrated, with earthy citrus, pear and melon flavors that have a minerally edge. Full-bodied and complex, with a long, earthy finish. Drink now through 2016. 17,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Crisp, with a core of citrus, pear, nectarine, herb and spice. The texture is a bit raw, but the wine is concentrated. Best after 1999. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Reserve
review: A scaled-down ZD Chardonnay, showing the signature dash of pineapple woven in with white peach and nectarine flavors. Still a bit raw, but should flesh out with a little time. Drink now through 2017. 750 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Aromas of citrus and toasty oak turn earthier and denser on the palate, with mineral, herb and sage notes folding in with the green apple and pear flavors, showing more depth and complexity on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Reserve
review: Earthy, stemmy wild berry and blackberry scents lead to a firm, structured young Pinot that's firmly tannic and should benefit from short-term cellaring. Best from 2007 through 2011. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Well-oaked, with lots of dill and mocha, framed around earthy berry and currant notes. Turns dry and tannic, with a woody aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 7,367 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Offers a mix of peachy tangerine and nectarine flavors that are medium-bodied, clean and vibrant, ending with scents of green apple and nutmeg. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Solid and well-rounded, with spicy apple, cinnamon and citrus aromas that lead to ripe flavors that show dill and spicy oak on the finish. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Floral, perfumed, ripe pear, citrus and honeysuckle flavors are refreshing, though they come across a little simpler on the palate, ending with a dash of cedar and dill. Drink now. 12,964 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Lean, with flinty, earthy, complex grapefruit, lemon, lime and tart pear and white peach flavors. Needs time to soften. Drink now through 2004. 15,170 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Intensely flavored, with a slight leesy, earthy accent to the ripe pear, pineapple and spicy Chardonnay flavors. Best to cellar short-term; try later this year or in 1998. 19,362 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: A flavorful, complex wine that balances crispness and good fruit flavors of peach and pear, with hints of honey, spice and vanilla lingering on the finish. Drink now through 1993. 15,819 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Reserve
review: The ripe white peach flavors have an earthy, leesy side, straightforward and pleasant, ending with dill and cedar nuances from American oak. Drink now through 2019. 720 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Reminiscent of a piña colada, with aromas of pineapple and coconut cream. A bit firmer on the palate, with hints of tangy pineapple, citrus and a touch of earthiness. Drink now. 960 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: A bit waxy and oaky up front, but the peach, smoke and nectarine flavors fill in behind; the oak returns on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 3,550 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Serves up a core of ripe, zesty currant, raspberry and mocha-dill oak that lies heavy on the palate. Tannins are firm and chewy, so it's best to cellar short-term. Best from 2006 through 2012. 6,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Lavishly oaked and well balanced for the vintage, but comes close to having too much wood to match the fruit concentration. Still, you get a pretty core of currant and cherry-scented flavors. Not quite the opulence you'd expect from a '90, but an attractive wine nevertheless. 1,154 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: This polished, supple wine has spicy oak notes, moderate cherry and plum flavors and firm tannins. Very stylish and seductive, even if it may not have the flavor substance for long aging. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Combines intensity with finesse. An elegant, richly flavored wine, with tiers of pear, spice, apple and melon flavors and pretty oak shadings that add dimension. Youthful and tight; drinks well now. 14,696 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Smells ripe and floral, with simple peach and melon fruit that slowly builds depth, aided by toasty oak. Solid but unexciting. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Earthy, with dry peppery, minty and herbal notes that come across as simple yet pleasant, picking up a dried cherry and berry edge on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 5,356 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Rosa Lee
review: Lemon, orange and peach flavors are mellowed by candied coconut flavors, taking on a fleshy, tangy ripeness. There's good acidity to balance it out. Drink now. 552 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A dark, dense, concentrated wine, with earthy currant, cedar, tobacco, plum and leather notes that turn dry and earthy, making its future difficult to predict. Best from 2005 through 2012. 5,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A bit muddled in focus, with an appealing core of moderately ripe plum and cherry flavors shaded by herb, dill and cedar notes that give a sense of complexity. Dry and tannic on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 3,010 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: An exotic style featuring grapefruit, mango and guava flavors. Turns simple and loses its intensity on the finish.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: A strong oak presence gives this a varnishlike edge, masking the ripe pear and nectarine flavors underneath. Takes time for the fruit to push past the oak. Drink now. 3,709 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Lots of spicy mint, dried berry, sage and loamy earth flavors mark this direct, intense, yet uncomplicated, Pinot Noir. Drink now through 2015. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Strawberry and brewed tea notes are pleasant and smooth, with an herb-tinged finish. Drink now. 3,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Leans toward the vegetal side, with crisp acidity and potent gooseberry and asparagus flavors. May remind you more of a Kiwi Chardonnay. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros 40th Anniversary Reserve
review: Lots of oak and a sweet-sour mix of flavors give this a curious flavor profile. Clean and refreshing, yet a bit off-kilter. Drink now through 2014. 400 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Dry and leathery, like a new pair of shoes. Doesn't quite muster the fruit; hits of dried berry and sage are modest. Drink now through 2004. 1,474 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Tight and cedary, with a green streak running through the earthy mushroom and taut plum and berryish notes. Give it time in the hopes it will improve. Best from 2001 through 2007. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: A well-oaked style, but the fruit stands up to it, with moderately rich cherry, herb and tobacco flavors. Finishes with firm, dry tannins. 3,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Reserve
review: Earthy, with a hint of gaminess to the dried berry and nutmeg notes. Though intense, this never finds a focus. Drink now through 2010. 930 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Intense, showing citrus and tropical fruit flavors, with a hint of pineapple, joined by a touch of oak that has an edge of cedar and pencil shavings. Drink now. 24,834 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros
review: Bold, rich and intense, with a good dose of oak and ripe cherry, cola and spice flavors. The finish gets a little rough and chewy, showing a strong oak character. Drink now. 1,080 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Lean and leathery, with notes of black cherry, licorice and toasted herb. Dry and cedary tannins grip the finish. Drink now through 2010. 6,700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Simple, with a waxy oak edge to the tart green pineapple flavors. Drink now. 15,406 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Ripe and smooth, perhaps a little sweet, with a fruit cocktail and grapefruit range of flavors that persists on the finish. Ends up firm and a bit austere. Drink now. 14,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Au unusual flavor like pink grapefruit dominates but there are subtle oak and spicy nuances that give this wine complexity and length.

name: Chardonnay California 40th Anniversary
review: Good, but with an odd woody hazelnut note to the trim pear and melon flavors. Intense and full-bodied, the dill-laced oak has a strong presence. Drink now through 2013. 17,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Heavy-handed oak is the dominant flavor and theme in this rich, mature-tasting wine. Whatever fruit lurks within struggles to bypass the dill and cedary oak overlay. Drink now. 1,900 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Not much in the way of fruit or complexity, with a touch of sour cherry, fresh earth and cedary notes that leave you hoping for more. Drink now. 2,828 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Light style, with earthy cherry and leathery flavors. Drink now. 4,029 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Dry, earthy and leathery, it's struggling to find a fruit focus and thus seems wanting in character. Give it some air, and dried cherry and berry emerge. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Founder's Reserve
review: Earthy and a bit funky, full-bodied, with a dash of earth and barnyard mixed in with dried berry and sage. The better of two bottles tasted. Drink now through . 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros
review: A tart, tight wine that's tannic and tough in texture, with raspberry and red cherry flavors and a drying finish. Drink now. 1,646 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros
review: An earthy wine, with tiers of spice, pepper, plum and leather notes that keep it interesting. Balanced, full-bodied and quite approachable now. 1,058 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Extremely tarry and vegetal, with enough ripe cherry and currant fruit at the core to provide some hope that it might come around perhaps by 1993. Not too tannic.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Ordinary, with simple pear, citrus and light pineapple flavors. Finishes with an odd, woolly aftertaste. 19,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Reserve
review: Intense, with hard tannins and a simple, narrow band of earth, cola and lavender, ending with a berry note and woody flavors. Drink now. 581 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Turns lean, with berry, herb and cedar flavors wrapped in tart acid.  Drink now through 2007. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: A bit muddled in its focus, with earthy sour cherry, anise and pencil lead shavings giving it a dull and somewhat astringent aftertaste. Drink now. 3,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros
review: Hard-edged and woody, with an undercurrent of concentrated black cherry flavors plus hints of cassis and cinnamon.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Walks a tightrope between earthy, barnyardy notes and ripe fruit flavors. Ultimately the earthiness wins, making this a tough wine to like. 1,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Herbal, bordering on vegetal, with tomato, herb and celery aromas and flavors that are more prominent than the modest cherry flavor. Tannic and tough on the finish. Good drinking starting from 1994. 460 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Light-colored and sour, with earthy, weedy flavors that are well off the mark. 3,024 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros
review: Hard, lean and dry, with more oak than fruit, which is unusual for this producer. Doesn't taste ripe. 1,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Intensely flavored, with an earthy, leathery streak running through the wine, robbing it of its varietal character. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Nicely juicy, with tropical details to the core of citrus and apple flavors, including passion fruit and a touch of coconut water. Impressively intense and persistent on the long finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Crisp green apple and Meyer lemon flavors are vivid and refreshing, with a touch of Key lime pie and lemongrass on the finish. Drink now. 9,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Pointed and deft, with lemon-lime, grapefruit and green pear flavors. Grass, chive and crushed stone notes linger with tropical undertones in the tart finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Built around a core of passion fruit and lime flavors, with lemon thyme accents that lend this fragrant lift and a crisp finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Fresh and crisp, with pleasantly grassy grapefruit, orange sherbet and lime zest flavors on a light body. Offers good focus and a lingering finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Precise and very tasty, this wine exudes passion fruit, kiwifruit, melon and ripe mango flavors. Well-balanced, bright and juicy, this is terrifically refreshing. Drink now. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Melon, citrus and peach flavors show a juicy fragrant note, graced by a whiff of white flower blossoms. Offers accents of fresh herbs and succulent acidity. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light-bodied and refreshing, with floral honeysuckle details and a core of lemony flavors, finishing with a grapefruit note. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Syrah California Bolero
review: Dark and brooding, showing only modest complexity with blackberry, coffee and licorice fruit plus firm, gritty tannins. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Fusion
review: Tired and rather dried out, with muted cherry, cinnamon and Sherry-like notes. 800 cases made.

name: Serience Horse Heaven Hills
review: Lithe in texture, popping out lovely blueberry, plum and spice flavors that ride easily on a sleek frame. The tannins bite only slightly. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah, Counoise and Cinsault. Drink now through 2013. 1,300 cases made.

name: Serience Red Columbia Valley
