review: Lithe, lively and appealing for its pure berry and currant flavors, smooth texture and graceful style, echoing the fruit nicely on the finish. Grenache, Syrah, Counoise and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Serience Red Horse Heaven Hills
review: Bright and appealing for its juicy blackberry, mineral and grapefruit flavors, lingering nicely on the crisp finish. Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre, Counoise and Cinsault. Drink now through 2009. 875 cases made.

name: Serience White Columbia Valley
review: The peachy-apricot and honeysuckle character of Viognier dominates the blend, which balances a nice touch of citrus on a bright, fragrant finish. Viognier and Roussanne. Drink now. 675 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Columbia Valley
review: Broad and generous, a juicy mouthful of spicy cherry and a touch of earth as the flavors linger against fine-grained tannins. Best with food. Drink now through 2010. 475 cases made.

name: Columbia Valley Rosé
review: Pale color, spicy, little fruit. Made from Grenache, Syrah and Viognier. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Beautifully crafted, sleek and trim, with well-defined dried currant, berry, loamy earth, smoke and cedar notes. Shows a sweet edge to the ripe berry flavors, ending with a crushed rock feel to the tannins. Drink now through 2027. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Taut, dry and tannic the result of a raw texture. The core blackberry, charcoal and cedary oak flavors are edgy. Time may work to its advantage. Drink now through 2026. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 375 cases made.

name: Trousseau Gris Russian River Valley
review: Bold and crisp, with lemon meringue, green apple and grapefruit notes, featuring plenty of grated ginger and citrus zest accents. Offers a zingy, mouthwatering finish. Drink now. 568 cases made.

name: Trousseau Gris Russian River Valley
review: Ripe peach, pear and apple flavors reveal citrus zest aromatics, with a floral touch and softly juicy acidity. Shows good intensity on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Very full and spicy, with generous vanilla and nutmeg-tinged apple and citrus aromas and flavors, lively and long. With its crisp acidity, this wine could be enjoyed now or left to develop with aging until 1992 to '93.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
review: This is frankly herbal and shows distinctively varietal character in its aromas, but it rounds out the flavors with soft, charming pear and apple—a fine balance that enhances its value. 3,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Reserve
review: Has a good dose of toasty, buttery oak, but pretty ripe fruit to match. Pear, melon, caramel and toasty oak flavors and a smooth, creamy texture make this an altogether very pleasant and attractive wine. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Fairly complex style with cedar, spice, ripe plum and cherry flavors delicately woven together in an elegant, easy to drink style. Well balanced, ready to drink or hold. Finish is long and flavorful.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Fresh, smooth and creamy, with elegant pear, apple, spice and vanilla flavors that glide across the palate, finishing with hints of almond and hazelnut. Ready to drink now. 33,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Plenty of butterscotch and honey aromas and flavors flesh out the ripe pear notes in this rich, unctuous wine. A decent Chardonnay that's drinkable now, but probably better in 1991 or '92. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County
review: A racy, herbaceous style of Cabernet that's drinking well now, but is less interesting than it was five years ago.--1978 California Cabernet horizontal.

name: Chardonnay California
review: A fresh and spicy mouthful of nectarine, resin and vanilla flavors that soften on the finish. Drinkable now.

name: Chardonnay California
review: A lightly fruity style; ripe pear, apple and melon flavors finish with a trace of oak. Drinkable now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Merlot California
review: A straightforward beam of cherry, berry, and cranberry flavors, and a hint of sarsaparilla. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Velvety and gentle, with moderate plum, cherry and strawberry aromas and flavors and light tannins. Already drinkable. A good value. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Simple with a lean band of spice, oak and pear flavors, but it fails to take off beyond that. Ready now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Soft, fruity; with appealing peach and nutmeg aromas and flavors and a touch of buttery oak. Simple and pleasant.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
review: Light and refreshing, offering grapefruit aromas and flavors along with the varietal grassiness. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Earthy, mineral flavors dominate the fruit in this odd Chardonnay. Has a tobacco edge on the finish. May be best from 1999. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Bright and fruity, offering a bitter woody streak that takes away some of the charm. Try now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Oaky and herbaceous, with a drying leathery edge; turns spicy toward the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Doughy, with spicy notes of roasted lemons. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Veers strongly toward the herbal, vegetal style but softens a little on the finish.

name: Chardonnay Alexander Valley Warnecke Sonoma Vineyard
Merlot Napa Valley
review: Earthy with a stalky, herbal edge and a modest core of berries and cherries. 1,346 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills ∑ Single Vineyard
review: Light and zingy, dripping with gorgeous raspberry, strawberry and floral flavors, weaving in strong mineral notes as the finish gains momentum. A hint of pepper informs the aftertaste. Drink now through 2023. 302 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Block 14 Single Vineyard
review: Sleek and inviting, polished and deep, with cherry, cinnamon, clove and mineral flavors that meld seamlessly and keep singing on the long and expressive finish. Drink now through 2023. 81 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Slope Single Vineyard
review: Rich and expressive, featuring black cherry and pepper notes set against tangy mineral flavors. Comes together smoothly as the finish gains traction, with a light bite of tannins. Drink now through 2023. 348 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Conifer Single Vineyard
review: Supple and expressive, with vibrantly layered raspberry, rose petal and spiced cinnamon flavors that glide toward a polished finish. Drink now through 2023. 235 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Slope Single Vineyard
review: Focused and refined, with rose petal and raspberry aromas and well-built cherry, sweet anise and spice flavors that finish with polished tannins. Drink now through 2023. 735 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills The Sum
review: Elegant and sleekly complex, with floral cherry and crushed stone aromas and focused, delicately layered raspberry and white pepper flavors that glide along the easy finish. Drink now through 2024. 286 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Conifer Single Vineyard
review: Light and expressive, with a steely edge to the cherry, blackberry and spice flavors. Hints at orange tea as the minerally finish lingers. Drink now through 2021. 240 cases made.
